66 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
3.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 février 2021
人与松鼠的和谐之旅《NUTS》：注定小众的解密游戏

一款有着奇特画风的解谜游戏。游戏时长2-3小时，解密形式新颖又简单。由于游戏画面仅使用了两种颜色并且没做阴影设计，给玩家带来的是一种意境，因此这款游戏注定是小众游戏，不过小众游戏总是能给玩家带来惊喜，在这款游戏中玩家将作为松鼠跟踪调查员，调查各处森林中松鼠的活动轨迹和藏物处。玩家需要在白天在松鼠已知出现地点放下摄影机，在夜晚观看摄影机的视频，在松鼠出现的时候拍照并跟踪松鼠，直到发现松鼠的藏物处。游戏通过玩家与松鼠之间的互动，指引玩家关注被人类破坏的森林，演绎了一场人与松鼠之间的和谐之旅。
　欢迎关注 网易UU鉴赏家培养计划
　来这里找优质游戏、开黑日友、白嫖UU时长卡　
　加速Steam社区、游戏记得用UU哦_(:з」∠)_　
富有“新意”的游戏画面

这款游戏的游戏画面采用了十分大胆的设计，游戏整体画面是由两种颜色组成的，虽然每个关卡的颜色不完全相同，但都仅使用了两种颜色。同时游戏画面仅有物体之间的远近关系，物体是没有阴影的，导致玩家初次观看到这种游戏画面会产生方向感的迷失(好在游戏中有设定全球GPS定位器)，但在进入森林后，这种画面的优势就显现出来了，没有阴影的画面使得玩家在遮天蔽日的森林中能够清晰的看到地面，从而更好地跟踪松鼠。

到了游戏后期，采用两色设计导致玩家的解密难度上升，不过好在这时游戏已经来到末端，在游戏的最后，这种两色设计带来的心灵感受要远远强过正常的游戏画面，那个拯救玩家性命的东西就那样突然出现玩家的眼中，散发着与众不同的色彩，上面的成群的松鼠与玩家一起构成人与自然的和谐之美。

不过缺点就是游戏画面过于意象化，需要玩家的代入感才能让玩家感受到游戏想要表达的含义，就游戏画面整体而言，还是有些奇特，可能会劝退很大一部分玩家。

源自生活的解密方式

正如前文所述，游戏中玩家扮演松鼠跟踪调查员，因此游戏的流程也比较贴近野生生物调查员的实际生活。游戏的一开始会给予玩家一个松鼠的初始位置，玩家则需要在白天的时候放置好摄影机，等待夜晚降临后，小松鼠会在初始位置出现，跑向自己的藏物处(就是松鼠贮藏食物的地方)，玩家所要做的就是通过白天不断地放置摄影机，寻找松鼠的行动轨迹(游戏中松鼠的行动轨迹完全固定)，最终发现松鼠的藏物处并用摄影机拍摄一张松鼠的照片发送给雇佣玩家在这里调查松鼠的主管人员。

这个解密松鼠行动轨迹的方式比较平常，也没有其他特殊的地方，因此玩家仅在初次尝试时感觉游戏解密方式新奇，但之后玩家就会觉得这种解密方式偏向机械化，好在游戏中后期开始引入剧情，将调查松鼠的轨迹变为推进游戏剧情前进的要素，游戏的整体流程也较为短小，2-3小时左右即可完成全部游戏内容。这样整体看下来玩家会觉得游戏解密设计还蛮不错的。

文末提醒大家，这款游戏的画面不适合所有人，解密也仅仅只是有新意，原价购买还是要谨慎一些。游戏评分：7/10，部分游戏画面的颜色过于艳丽会影响玩家观感，游戏解密部分游戏机械化缺乏灵动，但游戏整体表现不错，且剧情也能给予玩家些许触动，因此给予7分，如果哪天它入包或者打折到20-30的样子还是值得一试的，毕竟有着70块钱买点打折的大作或者最近火爆的国产游戏不香嘛。
 
W-ISSAC
605 produits enregistrés
0
46 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Recommandé
4.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 février 2021
Nuts is a fantastic little game with fantastic art and sound design. I played the demo when it was released and immediately fell in love with the look and feel of the game. The best way I can think to explain the extreme appeal of this game to ME is that it feels like you are occupying a liminal space. Like you are on the threshold of two planes of existence. From the desolate bus stop that you initially arrive at to the wide empty forests with these strange little squirrels being the only living things besides yourself… it’s strange, perhaps even a bit eerie in later chapters, but overall peaceful.

Your goal in each chapter is to photograph the paths of squirrels and track them back to their nests. Nina calls you to tell you about your goal and where the squirrels end their path. You trek out into the woods to set up video cameras, hit record every night, wake up in the morning and play back the footage to see how you need to adjust your cameras, go out and place your cameras in different spots accordingly, and day by day make progress on tracking the squirrels back to their nests. There are five locations, each with different goals, each with different color palettes and interesting environmental objects to wander across. It’s calming and nice.

I don’t really care to compare games to other games as I think most of them stand perfectly well on their own two feet regardless of where they pull inspiration from, but I very much feel that Nuts was not just inspired by Firewatch, but was nearly a copy of Firewatch. Without spoiling anything, they're just too similar in too many ways. This is not a bad thing, especially not if you love Firewatch, but I can’t not point it out.

I only really have two complaints about Nuts, and admittedly they are minor, but are worth mentioning.

1. At times, the gameplay can feel a little tedious and causes the pacing of the story to stutter a bit. Each chapter starts out fun enough but sometimes Nina updates your goals to something… less fun. One mission being, ‘I need you to fax me shots of the squirrel at 0:10, 0:20, 0:30, 0:40, 0:50, 1:00.’ But why? Not a big deal to me considering the length of the game, but could turn some people off.

2. Much like Firewatch, a mystery begins to unfold. Any time this happens in a game I get VERY excited. And like many other games, I was VERY disappointed. There was really nothing much to the story in the end and the mystery also did not affect gameplay in any way (in a game where the primary gameplay mechanics are setting up videocameras and reviewing nighttime footage… nope, didn’t utilize that). The game shines in many ways but would have been infinitely better with a stronger, punchier story.

However, at the least, the ending (despite not resolving any part of the mystery, really) was satisfying and strange and beautiful. Perhaps not QUITE set in a reality that we’re familiar with. Somewhat folklore-ish. I loved it. You’ll just have to see for yourself.

I do highly recommend this game. Maybe on sale, though. It's a bit short.
 
paimona

A relaxing puzzle game intertwined with a compelling and intriguing mystery. Most notably, the game is fuelled by its highly stylised and mesmerising art-style, bringing reference to other surrealist games like post-void or jazzpunk. So far, the game reminds me of firewatch's calm beginning.

Non recommandé
3.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 mai 2021
Классная задумка с расставлением камер и слежкой за белками.

К сожалению, в ходе игры этот геймплей не получает никакого развития, а сам по себе слишком прост и лично мне уже надоел на третье "выслеживание".

В остальном, сюжет разочаровывающий, "тайна белок" не раскрыта, продолжительность всего 3 часа, визуал достаточно дешёвый, некоторые цветовые пары подобраны крайне вырвиглазно.

435р. за такое явно перебор.

Более подробно рассказываю об игре здесь:

25 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
5.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 juillet 2022
I really expected to like this game, and am disappointed that I didn't. I did really enjoy the camera-based game play, and the graphic style, and even the voice acting. But the story fell really flat for me.

Honestly I feel like the game trailer tried to actively trick people into thinking there would be an intriguing story, maybe something with conspiracy or supernatural elements. There isn't. It was just a standard evil-companies-tries-to-build-something-in-a-nature-reserve tale, with no twists or surprises of any kind.

You can find tape recordings around the forest from a previous researcher, but there is nothing mysterious or interesting about them either - they may as well have just been a piece of graffiti saying "Nora was here, 1982."

There are things around you wouldn't expect in a nature reserve like an abandoned church and a pile of cars (?), but they don't matter at all and the game has nothing to say about them.

The ending is abrupt, doesn't answer anything, and felt really unsatisfying. It also didn't actually have anything to do with the evil company either.

Yeah, no thanks.
 
Riftsong
0
42 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
24
Non recommandé
3.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 décembre 2022
NUTS это скучно, грустно, и для такого геймплея — дорого. Симулятор расстановки камер, длительностью в три часа, в одном и том же порядке в аляписто прорисованных локациях. Хотелось провести приятный вечер, а получилось провести унылый; многим проектам часто тянет поставить не красный отзыв, а нейтральный, но вот с NUTS прямо другой случай. Тут отзыв красный-красный-красный, как red flag, висящий на шее симпатичного незнакомца (незнакомки) в баре в пятничный вечер. Вам не завезут ничего интригующего или уютного вследствие такого знакомства — только, вероятно, недоумение и головную боль. Ещё и за коктейли сами заплатите.

Визуальный стиль заявлен (если я верно поняла) главной фишкой игры — цвета иногда подобраны здорово, иногда ужасно, но эксперимент опасный в любом случае, большинство людей, скорее всего, в восторге от ярких пурпурных и цианидно-бирюзовых оттенков не окажутся. Во всём этом пёстром великолепии необходимо ещё и передвижение белок фиксировать — неудивительно, что ваша начальница, висящая на телефоне, порой не в состоянии разглядеть жертву фотоохоты (и просит переснять.. пару-тройку раз..). Из-за специфической рисовки в игре нет ни красивых пейзажей, ни в целом моментов, что хочется скринить — это плохо даже для детской раскраски. Вот вы бродите по почти одинаковым местам, носите за собой камеру: одну, вторую.. Переставляете, вас привозят к следующим. Супер!
Повторить до выпадения финального достижения.

Геймплей? У него 0 развития. Сюжет? Глухо, пусто, без концовки, без завязки, борьба со зловещими капиталистами, уничтожающими природу, происходит в телефонном режиме. Нина на проводе пытается убедить, что это дело всей нашей жизни — но не получается даже у её старых диктофонных записей, разбросанных по лесу. Пазлов, собирающихся в конце, головоломок или клиффхэнгеров тут нет. Почему белки ведут себя не как белки? А хз. Натуралисты не дадут ответа. Строят там что-то плохие ребята? Ну так и пусть себе строят.. Я бы вообще не назвала происходящее в игре полноценно сюжетом — заявленным к такому скучному слову требованиям он не соответствует.

Наверное, это могло бы быть мило.. или жизнеутверждающе. Но не сложилось. NUTS не хватает контекста — возможно, какое-то посвящение или строго выделенная в самом начале проблема, благодаря которой родился проект, могли бы ситуацию спасти.

Мой психологический возраст — максимум пять, и странные белки в плохо нарисованном лесу всё равно не вкатили. А ещё ценник здесь выше чем у GRIS, Eliza, Stardew Valley.. и равнозначен с Little Nightmares.

Если всё это был постмодернистский прикол — преклоняюсь перед разработчиками.
 
aenyeluned
369 produits enregistrés

62 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
2.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 février 2021
Having just finished the game (2.9 hours), I can't quite bring myself to recommend it at its current price point (£13)

PROS:
NUTS is a wonderful idea with an appealing aesthetic, and has a story with a decent premise. The voice acting is good - not What Remains of Edith Finch or Gone Home good, but it holds its own. Moving around is generously easy, which is important given the sparse visual cues, and the in-game equipment is a joy to play around with.

♥♥♥♥:
I very nearly fell out with the game immediately for not offering any kind of control customisation beyond mouse sensitivity. As a lefty mouse user, my right hand is now a palsied claw from three hours of WASD, Shift, C and Spacebar. I know from experience it takes less time to implement control customisation in Unity than it takes to complete this game; there is no excuse for omitting it. At all.
The second ♥♥♥ is performance. I know visual simplicity isn't always simple to achieve, but a laptop that is quite happy playing Assassin's Creed: Odyssey should not be making noises like an experimental jet engine rendering three squirrels and twenty yards of purple trees. This won't affect everyone, but be aware the system requirements are steeper than the visuals suggest.

The thing that stops me short of recommending NUTS, however, isn't the brutal lack of control customisation or the bitcoin-mining levels of juice it consumes. It's the fact that NUTS stops well, well short of fully exploring the space it creates, and left me with the sense of an opportunity squandered.

After the initial couple of day and night cycles, I was SO excited - and I mean first couple of Portal puzzles excited. I was ready to spend in-game months out there, piecing together clues. But where Portal goes on to expertly wring every drop of value from its premise without outstaying its welcome, NUTS leaves the lion's share of its potential on the table. I want to avoid spoilers, so let's put it this way: NUTS didn't do any of the things to me that I got excited thinking it might do. I mean, come on: it's a game where you place surveillance cameras in a supposedly deserted wood, and then watch the recordings huddled in your little mobile cabin at night! I'm not entirely sure how they managed to pick their way between the opportunities to mess with my head, so thickly did they abound, but manage it they did.

And then it ends. It ends very nicely, but it also ends very soon. The implication in the trailer (repeated in the in-game voiceover) that you might still be out there in the woods on night 23 of a particular section is borderline disingenuous. (The night count resets in each new location, which together with the repetition of (spoiler) briefly convinced me the squirrels had me trapped in a time-loop; I was disappointed to discover otherwise). It's very short, and I got no sense there was anything significant I had missed.

Perhaps it's unfair to rate a game based on what it could have been, as though it were a Star Wars film. But here there was so much clear potential, so much anticipation, that I'm finding it impossible to get past the fact that, at the end of the day, I just spent three hours watching five or six one-minute-long animations from a bunch of different angles.
 
Peeling

26 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
3.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 février 2021
Небольшой обзор для тех, кому было интересно и кто думает взять на старте.
Игра занятна. Главная механика — поиск путей белок через видеозаписи — пробуждает азарт настоящего охотника. Если вы помните какой-нибудь режим детектива в "Аркхемском Бэтмене", где надо идти по кусочкам дороги, восстанавливая картину события или доходя до важного места, то да, чем-то похоже. Палите маршрут белки на камере, к следующей ночи переставляете камеры, чтобы запалить новый кусок пути, и так пока не доберётесь до нужной точки. Вполне занимательно, тем более что проходится игра часа за три. Атмосфера природы есть, в памяти всплывает "Firewatch", но стиль тут превыше любой детализации.
Теперь о минусах. Претензий всего две. Первое, НИКАКИХ ответов на вопросы вы не получите, сразу готовьтесь. Игра нагоняет интригу, но узел не распутывается к титрам. Скажу лишь, что это вообще не хоррор, если вам так показалось сначала. По ходу сюжета встречаются кассеты для диктофона, местные записки то есть. Может, весь сюжет запихали туда, но, во-первых, я нашёл их всего три, во-вторых, ничего особо полезного они не рассказали, в-третьих, это просто уныние так поступать, если ответы на вопросы в записках. И второе, это местами недоваренный перевод: тут и "нет власти для генератора" (или типа того), и "найти, где идёт белка" вместо "куда", и "кредиты" в главном меню.

На один вечер самое то, особенно по скидону. Спокойствие и азарт.
 
AirCastleCrasher

Recommandé
8.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 février 2021
リス観察用のカメラはマップ内に自由に置けるので、プレイヤーの判断によってかかる時間が変わってくるけれど、絶対に詰むことなく達成できるところがこのゲームの良いところだと思います。(2/5現在はバグで詰むポイントもありますね)

リスの行き先を予想してあらかじめ先の方にカメラを設置したら一瞬も映らなかったり、デタラメに置いたカメラが偶然リスを捉えたりと、試行錯誤しながら小さな野生動物を追いかけるのはとても楽しく没頭します。
ビデオをチェックする作業はまるで本当に動物調査の仕事をしているような気分になります。

小動物が跳ねて飛んで集まる様子はとても癒されますが、対照的にストーリー展開は不穏でハラハラドキドキさせられました。
ストーリーの不穏な部分はほとんど回収できておらず、また解除の仕方がわからない実績もあるので、まだまだ気になる所も多いです。
情報を待とうと思います。

第五章で、何をFAXしてもニーナ博士から一切電話が来ず、ストーリーの流れ的に彼女の身に何かあったのではと心配しましたが、バグだったようで章のはじめからやり直したらちゃんとコールが来て安心しました。

電話を受けながらキャラバンから出ると受話器のコードが無限に伸びるので笑いました。

15 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
4.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 février 2021
独特なパステルカラーの色彩はレトロゲームのようですが、プレイヤーの想像力を掻き立てる憎い演出がされています。
さらにBGM＆音楽が雰囲気を盛り上げてくれています。

ゲームの内容はビデオカメラを仕掛け、依頼人の求めるリス映像を写真にして納品するのが基本となります。
カメラに映った数秒のリスの動きからその先の行動を予測して、次のカメラのセッティング位置を決めてまた撮影の繰り返し。
まるでカメラを使った推理ゲームしている感覚です。
ストーリーもしっかりしているので、そこも楽しめます。

しいて悪い点を言えばボリュームが少なく感じてしまいました。
まだ解決していないエピソードもあるのでアップデートやDLCに期待します。
（もしかしたら隠し要素があるのかもしれませんが・・・ノーヒントじゃ全部は見つけられないかな）

Produit reçu gratuitement

Incredible game. I wish I could erase it from my memory so I could play it unspoiled again.
Video Review:
Vidéo YouTube™: NUTS | Indie Squirrel-Tracking Narrative Mystery | Review 
Vues : 129
NUTS is one of those games I wish I could wipe from my memory so I could play it again unspoiled. Game Page: https://nuts.game/ ----------------------------------- ARI'S THINGS Patreon:...


Positives:
+Beautiful visual style
+Lovely audio
+Unique, engaging and compelling mystery/puzzle mechanics
+Immersive, tactile feel
+Seems to be colorblind-friendly
+Good options for subtitle and UI size
+SQUIRRELS

Negatives:
-Can't adjust music separately from other sound
-Can't rebind controls
-No real replay value
 
Secret Foxfire
1,169 produits enregistrés
0
10 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Non recommandé
4.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 février 2021
I feel like I am the perfect audience for this game—I love Firewatch, Gone Home and almost all first-person adventures / walking simulators. Recently I've enjoyed Call of the Sea and Old Gods Rising, despite their flaws. But Nuts left me very unsatisfied.

The success of a game like this rests on three things: The game world, the puzzle mechanic, and the story. Ideally, all three would be great, but usually one of them is weaker. So, Firewatch has an incredible game world and characters, but weak puzzles. The Witness has an incredible game world and puzzles, but no real story. Sadly, Nuts has an incredible game world, but the puzzle mechanic and plot just did not work for me.

The idea of surveilling and tracking squirrels sounds great, but turns out to be rather less fun as implemented. I found the process of dragging cameras around and watching the subsequent footage to be frustrating and quite dull. Even the visual atheistic, while striking, actually works against you in some ways. Yes, you can see the squirrels very easily, but the lo-fi nature of the environment makes everything look very much the same through the cameras lenses.

It's possible to imagine a version of Nuts that went much deeper on its puzzle aspect. There could have been different types of evidence of squirrel activity that you had to locate, different types of sensor and detectors you have to deploy. But instead it barely progresses beyond what you do in the first area.

The shallowness of the puzzle mechanic could be forgiven if the story and characters were compelling enough, but while the story has a lot of promise, it is mostly squandered. You are teased with the idea of a big evil corporation, up to no good, and a population of squirrels displaying some very strange behaviour. And you're alone in the woods, at night, with who-knows-what going on around you. There are a lot of intriguing possibilities as to what's happening, and what could happen to the player, none of which are explored. Instead, you get a bunch of phone calls where a character tells you about stuff happening elsewhere that never pays off. Just when I thought the game was about the open up and give me some answers, it ends.

Finally, the decision to have a nameless, faceless, personality-less protagonist is, in my opinion, a major mistake, and a failure to learn from what works in this genre. I think game designers imagine doing this makes it easier for the player to identify with the protagonist, but this is wrong. I wouldn't ever go and study squirrels in the woods for real, so I can't put myself into the story. Instead, like with Henry in Firewatch, or Norah in Call of the Sea, I want to get inside the mind of someone who would put themselves in this situation.

And the decision to have a silent protagonist hobbles the rest of the characters, because they have nobody to interact with. Compare the funny and moving conversations in Firewatch between Henry and Delilah with the expository phone calls you get in Nuts. Which seem more natural and real? Which draw you more into the game world and the plot? If you're telling a story, you need a main character, and simply relying on the player to invent their own does not work.

I feel bad to be so down on Nuts, especially when it's clearly a labour of love, and has some very talented people behind it. Part of me wants to say "not for me" and move on, but this a genre a love, and games of this ambition and potential don't come along very often. So it's disappointing when they fail to hit the mark, particularly due to what seem like errors in game design that could have been avoided with more critical thought about what really works and what doesn't in the genre.
 
Amtiskaw
0
18 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 février 2021
At the time of review I have not finished the final 2 chapters.
This is one of those games you see browsing the steam indie games page that wins you over off the concept alone.
NUTS is a simple game where you take photos of squirrels for the sake of squirrel research (with a shockingly intuative photo system) and unravel a mystery about what those furry goons are up to. I think you already know if that concept appeals to you.

I think the biggest negative is that after about 100 minutes of game time I have only 2 chapters left :(

I highly recommend this

Évaluation publiée le 11 octobre 2022
I find an increasing number of video games with surreal/overwhelming colors this year.

I played for 10 mins and had to stop, the strong contrast color is more than I can take. It feels wrong to give a negative review since I am at the beginning of Day 2, not experiencing much of the story. My advice is, if you like Firewatch you might enjoy this one, but make sure to let your eyes rest.

Recommandé
3.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 février 2023
Holy ♥♥♥♥. NUTS is actually so good. At first glance, you play as a ranger where you search for squirrels and track their location and activity. It felt so calm and relaxing until it all changes. The game has a little more to offer than just that. It taps on a real world issue and delivers a good job at that. The controls are SO CLEAN and the visuals are literally perfect. The colours change a lot and they are bright so make sure to rest your eyes. I cannot emphasize how well this game was made, it is short yet so enjoyable. Really really liked this game. RECOMMENDED!
 
wub7
2,305 produits enregistrés
0
10 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
3.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 février 2021
NUTS, where do I start. Wow this game felt so nice to play. Wonderfully done graphics, smooth frames (except for one chapter that was destroying my PC, but I think it was an easily fixed bug), amazingly intriguing premise. The mystery of Melmoth forrest had me captivated from start to, SPOILERS AHEAD, rather abrupt finish. Here is where the bad review comes in, and I will try hide any spoilers. A short, non spoiled recap will be at the end.
The game felt so amazing until the last chapter. There is so much mystery that comes to an abrupt end with no resolution. Does Panorama win? Does the research pay off after you leave Melmoth? What happened to Simon? Why did Nina have to leave and stop answering calls? Is Melmoth Completely destroyed from this flood? All of these questions go completely unanswered. Completely. This game often gets compared to Firewatch, and I do believe this is a fair comparison. But what makes Firewatch work is that the mystery does get solved. The part that breaks your heart in Firewatch right at the end is what leaves that unique feeling that very few games can replicate. NUTS fails to leave this feeling because there are just to many unanswered questions. This, matched with the so abrupt ending left me upset personally. The final tape of Nina at the end attempts to serve as a reflective moment. That although you were unable to solve the mystery, the fact that you were there is reward enough. I felt this emotionally, until I truly did reflect and just realize that the abrupt ending merely masked an incomplete story. A story with too many questions, and simply no answers at all.
To recap without spoilers, the games ending sucked. Some may have found beauty in it, but I found it to be too incomplete to enjoy. Now, if they release a sequel to NUTS, or maybe a spin off that is Nina's story that fixes some of my issues, I would take this review back in a heartbeat. No questions asked, I would even consider them both to be some of my favorite games of all time (assuming the sequel was as good). But as a stand alone experience, I can not recommend this game to any person who is not a fan of edging.
 
Maniac

Non recommandé
6.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 février 2021
I really wish steam had a neutral (Caveat-ed?) option, like a 3 star out of 5. This was a beautiful game, simple but engaging, and the story really roped my wife and I in. However, the 20$ price point for such a short game (2-3 hours), combined with almost all of the story that hooked us originally being left unanswered (Wife suggested even just a newspaper article being enough resolution), is what drags this just south of the 50% recommended line in my opinion.

The bottom line: It's a cute and fun game. If you can get this at 5-10$, I think that's worth the price, otherwise the end needs a little more resolution.

Kapitan Bank
362 produits enregistrés
0
18 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Non recommandé
3.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 février 2021
Особенности национального пиксельхантинга
Симуляторы бывают разные. Есть весьма проработанные и реалистичные, есть чисто развлекательные и несерьёзные. Игра с забавным для знающих английский названием «Орешки» не относится ни к той, ни к другой категории. И это даже не симулятор ходьбы, как кто-то мог подумать, смотря на явное внешнее сходство игры с небезызвестной Firewatch. NUTS находится где-то посередине, и когда вы осознаёте, чем вас намерены развлекать разработчики, становится слишком поздно. Вы уже в ловушке.

Ладно, давайте без утрирования. Итак, завязка. Безымянный главный герой устраивается работать фотокорреспондентом в древний и заповедный Мельмотский лес, где ему предстоит наблюдать за жизнью местных обитателей – белок. На связь с нами будет выходить профессор, которая ранее занималась этим, и постепенно нам будут открываться тайны и заговоры связанные с алчной корпорацией, явно замышляющей экотерроризм. Или нет. Или белки не то, чем кажутся? Или нет. И вот так во всём.

Одной из причин моего завершения игры, хотя я был в одной капле терпения от её удаления ввиду отвратительно неинтересного геймплея, о котором я расскажу ниже, были сюжетные повороты. Довольно неожиданные, эффектные, интригующие, призывающие строить теории – всё по заветам «Пожарного Надзора». Вот только всё это напрасно. Авторы накидали орехов на вентилятор, но никакого логического финала и ни единого объяснения хоть чему-либо в этой игре в финале не следует, и ты смотришь на титры и надеешься. Может, хоть после них будет хоть что-то?.. Нет. Увы. Даже с точки зрения банальных взаимоотношений персонажей всё очень плохо – единственный говорящий персонаж, то есть наша начальница, при постоянной болтовне с ней по телефону всё равно раскрывается очень однобоко и сумбурно из-за оторванности от контекста (а вернее, полного его отсутствия); то она строгая учёная, то отважная экозащитница, то безбашенный журналист. Молчание главного героя лишь усугубляет данную плачевную ситуацию.

Перейдём же к игровому процессу, и если вы, прочитав описание игры и посмотрев трейлер, всё ещё думаете, что это может быть интересным симулятором фотоохоты – спешу вас разочаровать. Позвольте описать вам типичную миссию в этой игре (они всё равно почти все одинаковые). Вам дают задание проследить за белками от одной до трёх штук, чаще за одиночкой. Вы ставите камеры в указанной точке, идёте в трейлер и жмёте на «запись». Смотрите записи, видите, куда побежала белка, идёте переставлять камеры и повторяете так до тех пор, пока не отследите её путь. А если она не попала в объектив – что ж, переставляете камеры, пока не найдёте. И так раз за разом, много-много раз.. Чувствуете? Постоянный бэктрэкинг и пиксельхантинг, минимальное количество механик при общем однообразии миссий – будто бы этого было мало, вам ещё пару раз предложат заснять белку в определённые временные промежутки (!) или побегать за ней с фотоаппаратом (в таком случае проще обшарить небольшой лесной участок и найти её схрон без всяких камер). Если обобщённо, это даже нельзя назвать геймплеем. Это тупая, бессмысленная, дотошная перестановка камер, она не вызывает никакого азарта, лишь утомляет, а в моменты, когда начальница критикует фото, на котором белка изображена не крупным планом, словами: «Я НЕ ВИЖУ ЗДЕСЬ НИКАКИХ БЕЛОК!», вообще остаются только боль, страдания, ненависть.

Напоследок проговорю про визуальный стиль; он здесь, мягко говоря, довольно контрастный, и это, отчасти, может и вкусовщина, так как я видел и позитивные комментарии на этот счёт, но лично у меня глаза откровенно уставали от этих ярких сплошных режущих полигонов уже после часа игры. Нельзя сказать, что больно было всю игру, но и отсутствие нормальных настроек графики ситуацию никак не решает.

Итоги. NUTS – это странная игра. В ней чувствуется потенциал, и сюжетный, и геймплейный. Будь история более завершённой, и дай нам авторы больше игромеханической свободы, вроде возможности самому следить и управлять камерами, вполне вероятно, это был бы приятный авторский проект на любителя медитативных развлечений. Но без всего этого игра оставляет ни с чем, в процессе заваливая тоскливой рутиной и не принося никаких положительных эмоций, гася их в зародыше. И тут мне на ум пришли в качестве ассоциации игры Лукаса Поупа, схожие по свой сути и креативному исполнению. Но если Papers, Please и Return Of The Obra Dinn изящно балансировали между однообразной простотой и мастерством погружения и повествования, то белки до чего-то достойного внимания, при всей их шустроте и проворности, к сожалению, не добрались.

5 из 10 – посредственно
Спасибо, что прочли этот обзор! Если не трудно, оцените, насколько он был вам полезен, и можете посмотреть другие обзоры в моём профиле ;)

P.S. Локализация подкачала – субтитры местами отсутствуют, а некоторые документы на русский не переведены вообще.
 
Condor Freedman
552 produits enregistrés
0
8 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 novembre 2023
Genre
Ein First Person Story Driven Exploration Adventure

Story
Wir spielen einen oder eine Naturfotografen/in und sollen Fotos über mehrere Tage von einer gefährdeten Eichhörnchen Spezies machen. nach und nach passieren immer mehr Dinge die nicht in unserer Hand liegen

Gameplay
Das Spiel ist relativ entspannend. Man läuft im Prinzip in der First Person Ansicht durch ein kleines Waldgebiet und muss an markierten Stellen auf der Map eine Kamera aufstellen um verschiedene Eichhörnchen zu filmen. Dabei läuft das Spiel in 2 Etappen ab. Einmal das rumlaufen und aufstellen der Kameras (später bis zu 3 Kameras gleichzeitig) und dann wenn man dies getan hat, läuft man zurück zu seinem Wohnwagen und schaut sich die Aufnahme an um ein Eichhörnchen zu erblicken, hat man dies geschafft muss man das Bild ausdrucken und an seine Chefin faxen um weitere Anweisungen zu bekommen. Meist muss man ein Eichhörnchen vom Nest zur Futterstelle via Kamera aufnahmen folgen, was an manchen Stellen leicht frustrierend werden kann. Der Grafikstil ist wirklich Einzigartig. Jeder Tag hat eine Neue Gesamt Bild Farbe was sehr cool aussieht. Musik & Voice Acting sind ordentlich

Achievement Schwierigkeit 3/10
Es gibt insgesamt 6 Erfolge. Hierfür muss man das Spiel beenden, in Kapitel 5 eine Gitarre finden, 10 Fotos faxen & 3 oder 4 mal ein Foto faxen welches keine Aufnahme der geforderten Aufgabe enthält (meistens Eichhörnchen)

Pro/Contra
+ Story ist OK
+ Musik ist Ordentlich
+ Einzigartiger Grafikstil
+ Nette Gameplay Idee mit den Kameras
+ Achievements
+ Sammelkarten

- Preis ist zu Hoch (Hälfte hätte gereicht)

Fazit
Ein gut gelungenes Story Driven Adventure. Die Gameplay Idee mit den Aufstellen der Kameras fand ich sehr Cool und auch der einzigartige Grafikstil sieht sehr cool aus. Die Story ist etwas verwirrend aber nicht schlecht. Wer gerne solche Story Games mag, kann hier ruhig zuschlagen, es lohnt sich auf jeden Fall aber ich würde auf einen Sale warten


👑 Powered by HoI 4 Deu Curators group in German / English 👑⠀⠀⠀
  • Follow Main group
  • Follow Second group
  • Follow third group

Além disso, a física e a interação com os objetos é muito satisfatória, mas... Pena que é MUITO curto... Adoraria ver mais capítulos dessa história.

Évaluation publiée le 21 février 2021
Another relaxing indie walking simulator where you set up cameras during the day to track the path of squirrels during the night as part of your contribution to forest conservation. It was always satisfying to catch the squirrel further along its path. While the English voice acting goes begging a little bit, and the protagonist is voiceless, the story was fun, A welcome break from trying to 100% Yakuza 3 or trying to win in Apex Legends.

Évaluation publiée le 29 octobre 2022
Nuts es una especie de Firewatch pero ♥♥♥ ardillas y ♥♥♥ una trama interesante sobre el impacto humano en el ambiente y en las especies y como éstas se las apañan para seguir existiendo. Es muy relajante, sencillo estéticamente pero a la vez agradable, viene muy bien para tomar un respiro y desconectar un rato. No es muy largo, pero creo que su duración es justa.
No voy a n3g@r que amé perseguir ardillas ♥♥♥ la cámara y el final... me emocionó mucho. ♥
Sin dudas, una pequeña joya indie. Le doy un 10/10 sin dudas

공식 한글화 / 도전과제 O /트레이딩 카드 X

람쥐썬더 관찰 시뮬레이션 게임 !!

도전과제가 쉽고 한글화에 감사하는 마음으로 추천드립니다 !!

A somewhat fun, unique and relaxing game.

Short, and with a disappointing ending however. So try to pick it up on sale. $20 is a bit high for what you're getting.

Color blind people stay away!! A lack of accessibility options will make this game's color scheme your worst nightmare.

Recommandé
2.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 février 2021
J'ai passé un agréable moment. Mais qu'est-ce que j'aurai aimé que ce dernier soit plus riche et dense. J'ai acheté ce jeu, en sachant ce vers quoi je me dirigeais, de "l'observation animalière" qui est surtout là pour nous raconter une histoire. J'aurai pourtant cru que cette forêt nous aurait été plus ouverte, aurait été remplie de secrets à découvrir, de mystères mystérieux voire inquiétants. Et pourtant, on est plutôt face à un Firewatch-like, sans la même charge émotionnelle, mais avec un aspect "puzzle" plus prononcé (même si extrêmement simpliste, principalement de la triangulation de caméras), et surtout une construction en "niveaux" de tailles assez réduits.

Au final, le jeu est bon, puisque très agréable à parcourir. Mais décevant dans ses limitations en terme de gameplay et d'environnements.
 
WonderboyBB

10 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Recommandé
3.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 février 2021
This is a beautiful game, it reminds me a lot of Firewatch, which quickly became one of the more memorable games for me.

The mechanics is simple, yet fun, doesn't feel like it repeats itself too much, and it allows you to approach it in your own way.

The story was engaging, interesting, and heartfelt.

It is defeniately a great game for those into Mysteries, Squirrels, Walking Simulators, and unique aesthethics.

The design approach for the atmosphere and visuals of this games is 10/10, it really stands out as a unique entry while serving a gameplay purpose.

Defeniately a game worth your money and the few hours you are about to put into it.

Non recommandé
2.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 avril 2021
I like this game, it's was well worth the almost 3 hours I put into it. Grab it on sale or wait for it to inevitably end up in Humble. That being said, and spoilers ho,

You left two incredibly large loose ends in the plot there and those not being resolved kinda leaves the already sparse gameplay kinda bare. What was with the squirrel hoarding dynamite and who funded the study? These were 2 of 3 of the kick-off points for the entire mystery and they just didn't resolve. Ingenious setup and no punchline is the issue here.

You know, there's this great christian sci-fi time travel movie (Not time changer... the name eludes me right now) that has one of the most insanely well written and tacked down time travel plots I've ever seen in a film, period. The effects, sets, and production are amazing and it carries over some minor nit-picks like some not so professional acting. And then, 30 minutes into the movie, it ends just before we hit the climax point. Apparently, the project had already run it's 10k budget dry and was forced to stop production before the director went bankrupt. Frankly it's a tragedy because it could've been a huge cult classic sci-fi film.

Nuts is exactly like this. Really good art style, super puzzle mechanics, and all wrapped up in a neat bow of sinister intrigue. But 2 hours into the game, it ends just as it hits the climax. Did you guys run out of budget? Time? Did apple arcade screw the pooch? I'm not sure we'll ever get those answers. It's a tragedy, because this really should've been one of the finest indie hits around, locking arms with Return of the Obra Dinn or Baba is You. But unfortunately, in this state, it'll never be anything more then a drop in the sea of B+ games
 
Un développeur ou une développeuse a répondu à cette évaluation

550 produits enregistrés

Recommandé
3.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 février 2021
这是个玩法比较有创新的解谜步行模拟游戏。

主要玩法就是白天在森林里设置摄像机，晚上通过摄像机来找松鼠，松鼠每晚的移动轨迹是固定的，第二天白天再根据昨晚看到的东西调整摄像机的位置，继续追踪松鼠的去向，直到找到松鼠最终的藏身处为止。游戏总共有五关，每一关的玩法都不完全一样，每一关都会用到一个新系统，所以谜题重复度并不高。而且谜题难度也很低，总体而言解谜的过程还是比较轻松愉快的。有时候在找松鼠的同时也可以找到一些意外的小惊喜。

游戏的氛围有点类似看火人，剧情也和看火人一样带有一定悬疑要素，不过最终还是回到了一个治愈的故事上。剧情中心思想就是环境保护。和看火人相比，这个游戏体量还是偏小，总体感觉比较简陋。

游戏的画面非常有风格（从商店界面截图也可以看出来），每关的色调都是不一样的。不过缺点是颜色饱和度和对比度都比较低，总是有点白蒙蒙的感觉。（也可以理解成森林的雾气吧）

最后吐个槽，游戏的标题叫NUTS，我知道这是坚果的意思，但是还是老是控制不了地想到致德国指挥官：NUTS！

Bir ormanda sincapların yaşamını gözlemleyip, birtakım gizemlere çözüm getirmeye çalıştığınız bu tek kişilik macera oyununda; kameralarınızı uygun konuma kayıt için bırakıp, sonrasında da o kayıtları inceleyerek yaptığınız araştırmayla ilgilenen kişiye raporlar sunuyorsunuz. Recommandé
4.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 mai 2021
I played this game for the first time on stream a few days ago and my audience really enjoyed it! I wasn't sure what to expect from the game, knowing only about the squirrel surveillance aspect of it, but I was immediately very invested in the storyline!
Beautiful, unique graphics and soundtrack, and excellent voice acting! I'm not sure if the intention was to create a liminal, slightly unsettling world, but it really feels mysterious and bizarre.
The gameplay itself (setting up cameras and checking them) is also very unique and fun! It's so exciting when you finally catch just the tiniest hint of a squirrel you've been trying to film.
I plan to continue this game on stream, as well as replaying it on my own off stream - really enjoyable and memorable game.

Análise de Curador
Para conhecer mais jogos ❣ no nosso grupo da steam clicando aqui❣

Gráfico:
  • O conceito de arte é totalmente diferente, é tudo muito minimalista e lindo!
  • Algumas áreas tem uma paleta muito clara que chega a ser ruim ficar muito tempo.
Jogabilidade:
  • É divertido ter liberdade e descobrir cada vez novas funcionalidades, muito fluida e dinamica.
Áudio:
  • Não chega a ser um diferencial, mas não deixa a desejar.

Recomendação: ✅ Sim!
dona leida a écrit :
É o tipico jogo onde você não precisa esquentar muito a cabeça e pode relaxar!

4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 septembre 2022
Ending analysis in spoiler tags

A pretty good game overall but with a somewhat lackluster ending that asks more questions than it answers. It took me about three hours playing quickly and not going for any achievements or cassette tapes. I would recommend this if you enjoyed the experience of walking around in Firewatch more than the dialogue trees. Definitely worth when there's a good sale going.

The game does a good job of setting up a mystery, but it doesn't really capitalize on it. In the end, there are a lot of dangling plot threads. I... think that I know what happens and what was going on? But that's only with me making a lot of assumptions.

The following text contains spoilers for the ending and, possibly, the main mystery. Only unspoiler if prepared.
The ending of NUTS has the player following a group of surprisingly docile squirrels that have seemingly commandeered an old boat left by the corporation trying to develop that land. They bring the player to the boat and, from the credits scene, the player presumably pilots it through the flood, saving this microcosm of Melmoth forest that would be destroyed. Overall, the squirrels have displayed, as Nina says, odd behavior, but this is never really explained. My assumption is that they are unnaturally intelligent, able to divine the will of the development company and make decisions based on it (stocking dynamite and matches possibly to try to blow up the dam once completed, stockpiling food in an escape vessel and slowly leading someone capable of piloting it - or perhaps just saving the last human remaining in the forest as a kind gesture, it's unclear). Of course, Nina leaves before this behavior becomes unambiguously intelligent, so we never really get any sort of consideration as to why this has happened (which is fairly disappointing, since one of the big semi-spooky taglines for the game is figuring out, to quote the description, "why do [the squirrels] behave so strangely?")
Simon's fate is left ambiguous - it's implied he died, especially since he complained twice about a rickety bridge, and we see a collapsed bridge in the final chapter, but we never get any kind of confirmation.
We don't know if the corporation won with its propaganda or if the journal you escaped with was enough. We don't know if Melmoth forest was destroyed by the flood, if the flood was caused by the premature, illegal completion of the dam, or if it was completely natural. Technically, we don't even know if the protagonist gets back to civilization , or if they live out the rest of their days as the Lord of the Squirrels.
Of course, we can devise answers for these questions (I just did to a certain extent), but the fact nearly all of them are left unanswered feels more like an oversight than good writing.

Still though, despite the ambiguous ending, I still enjoyed the game. I would recommend buying it on sale for the atmosphere alone if you liked Firewatch.
 
GamerTommy

Decent 2-3 hour long walking sim with interesting graphics and an actual gameplay loop. Sadly this loop gets a bit repetetive at some point though.
Also the story doesn't really have a proper ending, it just ends abrupt. Basically there are 2 story branches and none of them gets an ending. Besides that performance is like really bad in some levels (15 fps frequently), in most levels its fine though (60+ fps).
In a sale it's still all right.

1,159 produits enregistrés

5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 février 2021
aaaaaaa! I didn't see the end coming and I really really should have. I loved it.

This is a really fun first person puzzle/exploration game about exploring Melmoth forest and the spirited creatures who live there. You are essentially tracking squirrels over a series a days, by using a limited number of cameras and trying to pinpoint where they go. Do you play super cautiously and place each subsequents day's camera close to each other, or do you try and outwit the squirrel and guess where they might go and fail horribly losing them...

I loved the art. It's almost monochrome, which gives the game a dreamy vibe, but each level's colours reflect a certain mood and style. The environment is nice too. I particularly dug the remains that were left behind, which hinted at an older and ongoing story, one maybe relevant to themes of the game.

The story was well told, with lots of nice thematic touches actually. It's told largely through phone calls at the beginning and end of every mission but also there are a few secret audio logs to find about a past mission to the forest. At first this seems like just a simple job, but quickly it becomes something bigger and by the very end starts moving very quickly. It's not handed to you and there is some level of putting it together which I appreciated. I enjoyed the change of pacing in the end most of all. The whole game rushes to a energetic finale and a beautiful credits sequence, that would be perfectly at place in a Werner Herzog film.

On the 'negative' side, you never get a chance to pet the squirrels. Maybe in DLC. xD
 
Llaura Dreamfeel
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 avril 2021
Quick points:
+ Placing cameras to track squirrels is interesting at first but gets tedious quickly
+ Story is interesting and ominous, but never really amounts to anything
+ Stylistically beautiful, nice use of shaders, especially differentiating between night time and day time
+ Simon was such a great guy that I suspected that he was actually evil (especially when Nina mentioned his other job but didn't sound too sure about what it was)
+ I liked the ending but not in the context of the story. In regards to the squirrels, it felt appropriate that they basically accepted you but in regards to the corporation stuff, it felt like there was just no saving the forest?

Overall, this game is made up of many beautifully crafted pieces but the glue holding them together feels like it was giving out. It's such a short game that I didn't really feel any emotional attachment to anything... The maps are awesome but it feels like you barely even get to explore, rather you just sprint between the path of the squirrel and the caravan over and over and over.... It never feels rewarding to discover a nest, rather, it feels more like a sigh of relief that you can stop running back and forth in the same area....

Also, the story is basically about how beautiful nature is. Nina even mentions in one of the found tapes that someone should bottle up the smell of the forest after rain and then corrects herself quickly to say that it's better to experience it in person. That being said, at no point did I feel immersed in the worlds I was in. There was no rewards in exploration and just wandering around in the environments, rather, the concrete goal is to take pictures of the squirrels and get out of there as quickly as possible. The audio feels well designed and immersive, but the game play and the visuals in the environments don't seem to match up. It's weird how (for most of the game) you only get to see the squirrels through a TV but when you go outside, there doesn't seem to be any sign of life whatsoever (maybe a few butterflies and whatnot but it doesn't feel like a forest).

Évaluation publiée le 4 février 2021
약간 주인공만 대사 없는 파이어와치 느낌

파이어와치에서는 산불 감시자였다면

여기서는 다람쥐 관찰 하면서 보고하는 알바 비스무리한것을 하게 된다

흥미진진한 내용이나 다양한 상호작용 요소 등을 보아하면 이전 파이어와치가 좀 많이 생각나는 작품이다

그럭저럭 볼만한 수준이다
 
빅비
1,432 produits enregistrés
0
6 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 octobre 2022
Unique, Engaging Puzzle Game

NUTS is an extremely unique game. From the art style, to the gameplay, so much of it, is unique and felt brand new to me. I was honestly shocked I had never even heard of this game before today. You play as a researcher in the field, studying squirrels and their movement patterns. There's an ongoing story about how your research is to protect them and the environment and an overarching theme about protecting the environment. The story was fine and did the job but I found the gameplay far more engaging and interesting. The normal price of $20 is too high in my opinion, so I'd recommend getting it on sale.

Presentation

The game uses a very unique art style, especially for a game largely taking place in the woods, a scenery that would normally be full of different colors. Every level is made up primarily of only 2-3 colors. This worked exceptionally well to my surprise. It really allowed you to focus on the squirrels, and the colors often fit the mood of what was happening in the story at the time, something I greatly appreciated. The music is well done, and often fits the mood. It's at its best in the later levels when it can be more atmospheric. The voice acting is also well done. The voice actors do a good job and you can tell what emotions they're trying to convey.

Gameplay

The gameplay of NUTS centers around using cameras to track squirrels and their movement. This is done over the course of multiple days since you can only set up a couple of cameras in fixed positions. This means you have to strategically place them in order to give yourself the best chance to see where the squirrels go. After you place the cameras where you want them, you go into a room and watch the cameras in order to either figure out where to place them next, or take the photo you need in order to complete your research. The game does a very good job of adding variety to the gameplay loop such as having you find out where the squirrels come from instead of where they end up, or tracking them yourself without the cameras. These little changes go a long way in keeping gameplay fresh and engaging.

Story

The story takes you on your journey as a field researcher, doing research on squirrels for a company who wants to stop a dam from being built. Your only connection with the outside world is through the person who takes you to each station, and the only character you physically talk to, Nina, a former researcher herself. Throughout the story you uncover the mystery of the company you're trying to stop, and some shady practices they're taking part in. It moves along at a nice pace and accompany's the gameplay quite well, giving you a reason to do what you're doing. My only real complaint with is it that the ending isn't that good in my opinion but it's not a big deal since the gameplay outshines it.

Conclusion

NUTS is a really unique game that was a breath of fresh air. It definitely won't be for everyone since it's a lot of repetitive tasks, but I found it highly enjoyable. It's a really relaxing, if not short experience. If you're a fan of unique puzzle games, definitely give it a shot, but only on sale. It's definitely not worth the $20, for the sale price of $7 is much more reasonable. For more reviews, follow my curator page.
 
Eggroll
2,977 produits enregistrés
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Recommandé
5.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 février 2021
一款很有创意的游戏，通过摄影机的录像来一点一点推断出松鼠的活动轨迹，以两人之力对抗大资本家，为小松鼠获得生存空间。从人类原始的技能和本能概括出的gameplay意外的好玩，感觉是一种比较高级的做法～虽然看起来画面的颜色是噱头，但实际是为了游戏性服务的哦！表现形式服从功能诉求的典型案例，值得一玩。

Évaluation publiée le 6 février 2021
神聖な森に、いたいけな大学生が、アルバイトで！！

森は生きている…。
神聖な森を…汚すな…。
そんなゲームでは全然なくはないんだけど、リス監視であるとてもきれいな公園を訪れた
大学生＝主人公が、博士の指示のもとに自然と触れ合うアドベンチャーゲームです。
PVから受ける雰囲気でFIRE WATCHみたいなのを想像するかもしれませんが、
そういう意味では少し肩透かしを食うかもしれません。
FIRE WATCHやGone homeほど斬新なナラティブを意識してはいないと思います。

個人的にはScanner Sombleに似ていると感じたので、
そっちのゲームをもしプレイ済みで面白かったと感じたならこれもオススメです。

いちおう僕の普通にのんびりしたプレイで３時間でクリアできたのと、
完全にリニアなストーリーで一部の鳥忘れ実績解除以外に一切やり直す要素ないので
買ったら目一杯遊びたいタイプの人はあんまり向いてないかもです。

"Nuts is an interesting game where the story fairly quickly overshoots the gameplay in scope. However, the tracking of the squirrels is an oddly enjoyable task, I just wished there had been a few more variables thrown into the mix towards the end of the game to make the squirrels harder to track, and the gameplay more interesting."

Non recommandé
4.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 mai 2023
THIS IS NOT a "surveillance mystery" game, as it claims to be.
Yes, they INTRODUCE a bunch of VERY intriguing mysteries, but you never get to actually "piece together what’s really going on in Melmoth Forest" because the game just... ends abruptly without answering any of the mysteries it sets up.

THE GOOD STUFF:
- The basic game mechanics of positioning your cameras during the day and then huddling around the monitors at night to see what happened was very interesting and new.
- The visual aesthetic keeps things simple and beautiful.

MORE BAD STUFF:
- I was hoping there'd be something creepy going on... something supernatural going on... maybe we see something scary or sinister happening on camera -- But nope. You never see anything running around except the squirrels.
- Having a silent protagonist made "conversations" over the phone very awkward.

OVERALL:
Extremely cool concept and setup, but squandered and wasted potential. Also, it's extremely short. Not worth $20 unless they add WAY more into it. Buy it on sale to at least experience the cool camera mechanics.
 
moogamoogamooga

Recommandé
3.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 31 décembre 2023
This review is specially made for those who like to get all the achievements in games (minor spoilers ahead).

Description:
NUTS is a walking simulator where you play the role of a recently graduated biologist that has to conduct a study on the local wildlife. You’ll have cameras and tv sets that you set up during the day to record the squirrels later at night. The cameras need to be placed at specific points and the irregularity of the terrain makes it harder than it looks. The story is interesting but unfortunately I don’t think it concluded properly as we don’t know exactly what happens in the end.

The graphics are stylized and the color palette changes in each chapter. Personally I like this original take but it might be a bit weird looking until you get used to it. The voice acting, sound effects and music is very good and creates an interesting ambiance.

The gameplay, as mentioned, revolves around placing the camera and photographing the squirrels and while it seems easy the path taken by the rodents is often unpredictable and trying to guess it cost me a few wrong tries a couple of times. My advice is keeping each camera in the frame of the others so you can figure out the right direction more easily.


Achievements:
How many: 6 Achievements.
How much time: 3 hours on my own, probably half with a guide.
Game difficulty: Easy.
Achievements’ Difficulty: Easy, but there are a few missables that can be replayed using chapter select. You need to send the wrong faxes 10 times, not skip cutscenes in the first chapter and find the guitar in the abandoned shack in the chapter where you have to place nuts . The rest can be obtained by playing the game and reaching the end.


Overall opinion:
NUTS is an interesting and original walking simulator with a bold visual style and excellent sound design and voice acting. The gameplay is fun and challenging, as keeping track of the animals is harder than it looks.


Join and follow my group Ribbon Hunters for more suggestions and reviews of easy indie games to get all the achievements.
 
Fbarok
2,259 produits enregistrés
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
2.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 juin 2022
Unfortunately, despite the fact that this game was cute and (mostly) well made, I can't recommend it.

It just did not have enough substance to it. I finished it in 2.6 hours, and I walked away a couple of times. There are a total of 5 areas, and the first four are effectively tutorials. When you finally get to the fifth area, you actually get to put everything together and do it yourself... sort of, as the mechanic introduced in the 4th area is only used for that area and nothing else.

The entire gameplay is "watch squirrels on camera, move camera 20 feet, repeat until you find their nest".

It would be a great game at $5. At its current sale price of $9 it is a little overpriced, and it absolutely is not worth the full price of $20 for what ends up being a stylized surveillance camera simulator with a very basic environmentalist story.
 
SinAscendant
798 produits enregistrés
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
1.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 décembre 2021
The gameplay is fairly simple and gets monotonous and easy very quickly. At its most complex you predict the movements of squirrels through a level that typically has one to two areas that could function as intricate "jungle gyms"but these never get used. Typically you just try to predict the movement of a squirrel through a fairly plain and monochrome landscape.

One would expect the art and story to carry it, then. While the style is unique, the game feels it necessary to remind the player of the beauty of nature, which is woefully marred by the simplistic style used here. The forest is completely devoid of life, bar the squirrels, and while birds can be heard chirping I saw not a single one flying in my two hours. While the flag flaps defiantly in the wind, trees don't sway so much as jiggle their bush-like canopies meant to simulate leaves.

The story is a heavily summarized plotline to a 90s TV special bar any kind of internal logic. The scummy corporation intent on burying the forest can get away with such an obscene amount despite the player's report being necessary under law. At any point I feel like the employees really ought to be in contact with at least one government official who can stop the dam, let alone the fact that they don't contact another newspaper who I'm sure would be happy to bury the other, corrupt one.
 
Joey The Big J Jojo

Évaluation publiée le 6 février 2021
ВАЖНО.
Игра прикольная, у нее есть и интересные моменты, но она достаточно маленькая. В смысле не только то, что для ее прохождение потребуется всего 3-4 часа, но и вообще по наполнению и разнообразию процесса. После просмотра трейлера вам, заинтригованным, все же стоит остановиться и задуматься. Не подумайте неправильно, у игры есть классные и интригующие моменты, просто вся мистика игры как то под конец уходит в никуда. Все же я как человек, который следил за игрой еще с прошлого года, ожидал немного большего. Не знаю как там иностранцы, но мне, со стороны российского игрока, кажется, что игра должна быть в 2 раза дешевле. Игра крутая, атмосфера замечательная, но просто сам весь опыт не тянет на те деньги, которые просят. Если у игры есть скидка, и вы любитель всего такого простого и атмосферного, берите не задумываясь.

3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
2.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 octobre 2022
Белки не то, чем кажутся
Стильно, минималистично и мутно — вот три слова, которыми я бы описал данный проект.

Даже по скриншотам видно, в какой необычный лес попадает главный герой NUTS. Сперва выбранный дизайнерами стиль изображения кажется немного вырвиглазным, но довольно быстро это становится изюминкой игры. А орешком игры становятся белки, за которыми нужно следить с помощью камер.

Можно сказать, что нам предлагают эдакий необычный формат пряток или догонялок, где отследить свою цель нужно по видеозаписям. И если вы беспокоитесь, что игра будет однообразной из-за малого количества механик, то спешу уверить, что такая фотоохота увлекательнее, чем может показаться.

Но авторы решили, что кроме слежки за белками игроку нужен ещё и сюжет. И сначала намечающееся расследование подаёт надежды на интересное развитие. Однако, увы, оно получилось каким-то странным и куцым. Игру это не портит, но ощущения остаются неоднозначные (вспоминается Firewatch). К слову, показанных в первом трейлере фрагментов в игре нет, так что, вероятно, сценарий в процессе разработки менялся.

В итоге хорошего в игре явно больше, чем плохого. Да и плохого особо нет, просто есть немного неоправданные ожидания. Зато тут есть белки.

P.S. Как устроиться на такую работу? Скиньте вакансии, пожалуйста.
 
Zhareg

Évaluation publiée le 4 mars 2021
Главные плюсы игры:
Что понравилось:

+ Сюжет
+ Простые и интересные головоломки
+ Простой и приятный геймплей
+ Приятная музыка
+ Приятная озвучка
+ Интересное построение игры
+ Проблемы поднятые в игре
+ Мир и его сюжет перекликается с реальным миром.
+ Поднятые темы
+ 10 орехов из 10
+ Белки очень крутые
+ Приятный стиль


Минусы:
- Игра короткая
- Не на все вопросы даны ответы
- Частично минус, можно забраться в труднодоступные места

О игре:

Инди, Симулятор ходьбы, Для одного игрока, Тайна, Казуальная игра, Приключение, Загадочность.

На что похожа:

Firewatch (внешне, чуток геймплейно) , Dear Esther, Sunlight.


Что можно добавить:
Симулятор хождения.
Похожа на Firewatch , но не совсем.
Медитативный геймплей.
Загадочность.
Есть ачивки и пасхалки.
Загадки могут показаться однообразными.
Игра на 3 часа.
Переживания героини и её взгляды и волнения были мне очень близки.
От любителя деревьев однозначный лайк.
Игра не для всех.
Проходить лучше за один раз.

Рекомендую к покупке на распродаже.

Création de la communauté pour Steam Artwork
Par : .ιlι. 「 Deomon 」 .ιlι.
10 орехов из 10


The main advantages of the game:
What I liked:

+ Story (plot)
+ Simple and interesting puzzles
+ Simple and enjoyable gameplay
+ Good music
+ Good work with sound
+ An interesting game design: how the levels are created, how the game is made, how it's colors, levels, narration are selected.
+ Problems raised in the game
+ The game world and its plot echoes the real world.
+ Topics ( theme ) raised inside the game
+ 10 nuts out of 10
+ Squirrels are very cool
+ Nice style

Minuses:

- The game is short
- Not all questions are answered
- I don't like that, you can climb into hard-to-reach places.

About the game:
Indie, Walking Simulator, Singleplayer, Mystery, Casual, Adventure, Inscrutability.

What is it like:

Firewatch (externally, a bit gameplay) , Dear Esther, Sunlight.

What i can add:

Walking simulator.
Similar to Firewatch, but not quite.
Meditative gameplay
Mysteriousness
The game has achievements and easter eggs.
Puzzles can seem monotonous.
Game for 3 hours.
The feelings of the heroine and her views and worries were very close to me.
As a tree-lover I would recommend this game
The game is not for everyone.
It is better to complete the game in one go.

I recommend to buy at a sale.

174 produits enregistrés

3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 février 2021
I have mixed feelings about this game. Long version here, tl;dr at the bottom

I really enjoyed it since my first demo playthrough, so I immediately bought this game on release. Art style is memorable, ambient soundtrack and sound effects are gorgeous, voice acting is great! Forest sounds so real and fantastic, you will look around "wait, is someone here?" often and it's really great feeling of being lost in the forest. Game really reminds me of Firewatch, which I truly love. Just go on walk, take pictures of squirrels and "find what's really going on in Melmoth Forest".

But premise "find what's really going on in Melmoth Forest" (it's a quote from the main description of the game) is not fulfilled. Yeah, many strange stuff is going on in this game, but you never will actually find out what the heck is happened. In fact, the amount of knowledge about plot of this game I had before playing is equal after I've finished it.

This game really reminds me of Firewatch, especially story-wise. If you've finished Firewatch, you know what I'm talking about. In the middle of the game story becomes really strange and creepy (in a good way - no jump scares or other horror stuff), I had a lot of goosebumps while playing and this part of the game I really enjoyed. But after credits roll, none of this is actually matters in terms of story. Yeah, I just spent 3 hours watching squirrels.

I had so many expectations from this game, but many of them didn't come to live. There is only 6 short "missions" (different locations with some tasks to do), the gameplay is almost the same on all of them and gameplay-wise it never actually evolves. Find squirrel, place some cameras, watch where that small beast goes at night and take a photo of it. Sometimes it's three squirrels, sometimes they walk in strange paths, but the core gameplay loop is actually the same - place camera and watch. I can't say it's boring or something, I really like the part of "reverse engineering" squirrel paths, but I just want you to be aware of the main gameplay. Developers could evolve the gameplay, bring a new "toys" to play or change old ones, like "squirrel movement path is not static now" or "squirrel walk where you walk" or something like that. Or maybe developers tried this and it didn't worked, that's why this game is so short. I dunno, I'm just a stupid text.

But I actually enjoy this game. Again, sound effects and voice acting is great, visually this is piece of art and the story is WOW up until the end. If you liked Firewatch (even the ending of it), you definitely will fall in love with NUTS. Game is short, very chill and awesome, so I can recommend it for walking simulator fans.

tl;dr: NUTS looks and sounds awesome; gameplay is kinda repetitive, but game is short so you're not bored; story starts WOW but at the end it's just meh; if you like Firewatch you should buy NUTS.
 
alxgrade
390 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Non recommandé
3.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 aout 2021
I may have spent more time thinking about this game after completing it than playing it itself. It’s just on the edge of a positive review, but there is too many thing going against it.

Nuts has an eye-catching shell that hides an empty core that pretends to be minimalistic. Everything at first glance looks interesting: graphics, gameplay and story, but when playing, you really feel ripped off, as if you were lied to. What you get is exactly what you see, no more.

Nuts is a beautiful game with unique appealing graphics. The gameplay is also fairly innovative. During the day, you plant down cameras to record the squirrel activity of the night and figuring out where they go. It’s interesting, because you have to guess where they are going and what’s the best possible angles to capture the most potential movement. And you have to review the footage with zoom and fastforward/backward, hunting for any activity captured. But that’s all that the game has for itself.

In term of story, you get a line phone with your research director, you have to listen to her short monologues (because your character is mute) between missions.

I think the game promises a lot, but delivers barely anything. Yes the “surveillance” gameplay is here. But can you really call it “surveillance?” It’s more like wildlife observation. Yes there are some “weird” things going on with the squirrels. But given the language of the promotional material, I was expecting actual weird, not just unusual stuff. This, with how the gameplay works, gives the impression that the game will iterate on the loop and improve it, make it more interesting (because toward the end, it really feels repetitive.) Instead… It’s more of the same, barely any spin on the same loop of planting cameras, looking at footage, repeat until you get to your objective.

I think the game tries to impart a sense of isolation to foster reflection in the player, but it fails. For one, the areas are too small to give you a sense of being lost in a large place and the art style with low details is actually quite claustrophobic. For two, there is human activity traces all around most maps. I think it also fails to evoke a sense of wonder for nature. The only visible lifeforms, the squirrels, act like robots, and the low complexity art style doesn’t do justice to nature. I was legitimately expecting more dynamic behaviors from the squirrels.

The game has basically multiple story lines that diverges, you expect some follow up on previous plot points, but nothing. I couldn’t connect with the player character or Nina, because they don’t really exist as people with personality, they are mostly here to advance the game. The squirrel feel like alien entities with motivations very unlike humans, so I didn’t feel a connection to them.

The game doesn’t know where it wants to go and at the end the devs just give up and say “sure, let the player decide.” It feels like the game ends midway through something great and just leaves you hanging.

I also want to point out that the system requirements for such a graphically simple game are not acceptable. Level 3 has a graphical bug: with my Ryzen 3900X and Radeon RX 5600, the game couldn’t hold 30 fps at 1080p. To be fair, the rest of the game runs at 4K 60 fps fine.
 
St. Gibonus
0

Non recommandé
3.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 décembre 2023
3.5/5 The game was cool and had a lot of good story elements but the ending felt... out of place? It felt very empty of any true ending, like they ran out of time and had to finish the game up as quick as possible. Overall a very cute game, very little glitchiness in terms of going out of bounds or getting stuck (On the swamp map it is possible to leap out of the map in several areas, as well as the area with the treehouse has a fence you can hop over and get stuck behind.) and no other notable performance issues. Overall if you just want a cute game taking pictures of squirrels, this is a good game. If you want plot resolution... mayyyybe look elsewhere.

aSecondStory

2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 octobre 2022
Ignore the silly and misleading name. This is a lovely little game that combines clever surveillance mechanics with minimalist nature exploration and a bit of tension and mystery. Be warned that gameplay can be quite slow and tedious. This is not an action adventure.

There's very obvious inspiration from Firewatch in the setting, story, and even mode of storytelling. Perhaps too much inspiration. I can forgive this blatant rip-off because the gameplay is otherwise original and delightful. Throughout the story there are several variations on the basic formula that keep it interesting. It's not that deep, though, so luckily the game is short enough that its core mechanic doesn't overstay its welcome. The visual style is also quite nice. It's been done before, but it's done well here, with a striking color palette and suggestive geometry.

There are some rough edges that could have been avoided with better design. For one, affordances and controls and not so great. I played with an Xbox controller, which is supported but very poorly, and it took me a while to realize this. Play with keyboard and mouse! Then, it's not clear what is clickable, and unfortunately the color coding of objects is misleading in this regard. Finally, and worst in my view, there are secret little documents you can find along the way that do a lot to enrich the story, but ... they are secret and easy to miss without a walkthrough. Why not let players experience this more readily? I see no point in keeping these secret.

As for its difficulty, I found all the tasks easy enough to complete with some patience, but the final puzzle was very annoying, because it introduced a mechanic that was never used before in the game. How was I supposed to know about it? Affordances! Provide them! Spoiler: I had no idea that I could climb trees.

All in all, recommended for fans for indie walking-sim puzzlers.
 
Emblem Parade
7,575 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
2
Recommandé
4.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 février 2021
*Spoiler Alert*

What initially drew me into buying this game was the thermal vision artistic effect and that it looked similar to FireWatch. The color effect is in my opinion the most successful aspect of the game for a couple reasons. Firstly the play areas are very small, but it doesn’t feel that way. This game would be almost impossible in large areas, and the odds of getting the cameras in the right spots would be quite a challenge in a large map. With the colored effects it was hard to see distance so the small maps never felt small. The visual effects also made it easy for the designer to highlight important objects and make them stand right out for the player. I also enjoyed the technology the game used, the surveillance system, fax machine, tack board, phone, etc...all felt very realistic and was a nice touch.

So there are a few things I just didn't love about this game. First off I hated the phone calls with Nina. She calls, states a fact to you, and abruptly hangs up. This to me is just not realistic, people just don’t talk on phones that way. I also hate that your own character never has any opportunity to speak or offer any thoughts or input. Not being able to talk and just be talked at by Nina made it hard for me to get any emotional connections with the characters. Now the biggest flaw that I couldn’t get past was the story itself. I don’t know anywhere in the world where a forest would be protected for squirrels. Squirrels are an extremely common animal of least concern on the conservation status. The idea that people would be paid to watch and protect basic squirrels just did not work for me. And lets not forget the most frustrating aspect of all, the ending or lack of. The story offers no closure and leaves a lot of loose ends.

All things concerned I do think this game is worth playing. I loved how quick and low commitment it was. The story itself has a less is more approach that I can appreciate. I think the art was pretty brilliant and I’d like to see more.

Évaluation publiée le 2 janvier 2022
リスの目撃地点をスタートとして、毎晩少しずつ監視カメラの位置を調節して巣穴を特定する。
その裏で不穏なストーリーが進行したりしなかったりしますが、求められるのは基本的にこれだけのシンプルなゲーム内容です。
効率を考えれば難易度は上がりますが、時間制限は無いので毎晩少しずつカメラ位置をずらしていけば誰でもエンディングに到達できます。
単純なゲーム内容なので「早く飽きるんじゃないの？」と思う方もいるかも知れませんが、心配しなくても飽きる前に終わります。そう、ボリュームは非常に少ないです。

ゲーム内容は新鮮で楽しい3時間ですが、2000円という価格はどうしても割高に感じてしまいます。
お金持ちに対してや大幅なセール時であれば手放しでおすすめできます。

Évaluation publiée le 19 juillet 2021
Sweet, a bit weird, more serious than I was expecting. Definitely taps into my "nature camp" childhood self that was all about being a gung-ho conservationist. The game is quite short (under 4 hours for average play), but the mechanic is engaging and feels good and the game mixes it up over the course of the runtime that it doesn't feel stale. Plus it's gorgeous so I never got tired of looking at it. I bought it on the Steam Summer Sales and had a really good time with it!
 
Kagedtiger
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 septembre 2021
"This lady sounds NUTS!"

NUTS is an unusual game, and that made me like it. You are tasked with researching squirrels, and to perform this task you must set up cameras in the forest, let them record animal movements overnight, and then review the footage you got in the morning. Maybe you pointed the camera the wrong way and got nothing, maybe you got precisely what you needed, or maybe you need to go back, readjust and try again the next night to learn something new. It's a very neat concept and not one I've seen done with this much freedom for the player!

The sounds of the forest, and the minimalist ambient music, also work well to build up an atmosphere. There is a great sensation of potential during the early moments of the game, of something greater eventually coming our way. Even the plot, focused around your research being used to prevent some greedy corporation from ruining the forest by damming the river, seems to hint toward something more mysterious and nefarious.

It is here, however, that the game lets the player down a little. A lot of the potential of this setting, and the gameplay mechanics, are never fully realised. It is my understanding the game was developed with limited time and resources, and the developers have done some great things, but as much as I like the idea of NUTS, I was left wanting something more.

There is also the minor gripe I have with the only voice actor of the game. Her voice and accent are fine for her role, but her delivery leaves much to be wanted, with some lines delivered with too much haste, not flowing naturally. I think you can tell the actor isn't a native english speaker, and this might have made it difficult for her to feel natural when doing her lines.

Finally I must also warn the reader of the colour scheme of NUTS. While I found it endearing in the way it uses limited colours and contrast to paint its world, several people I showed the game to complained that it was unpleasant to look at. I feel this will come down to personal taste and preference, so do take a good look at the screenshots in the store page before you take the plunge.

Still, even for a short game with a lot of potential left untapped, I have to recommend NUTS. It's not an action packed experience, nor will it envelop you in a grand story full of twists and turns, but if you'd like to spend an evening doing something no other game lets you do, toying around with mechanics no other game offers, NUTS is a good investment.

Playtime: 3+ hours (Single playthrough)

Ratings (1-10)
Visual: 7
Audio: 8
Story: 5
Gameplay: 8
Overall: 7
 
WHAM

Recommandé
2.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 septembre 2022
Nice short game with an interesting plot and fun game-play. I really liked the art design and visuals of the game and I had a lot of fun. My main issue with the game was that I found the ending underwhelming. The story throughout the game was quite compelling and full of mystery but by the time I was finished, I had more questions than answers and the main plot points of the game were left unresolved. I also wish that the game was a bit longer as I was really enjoying myself but another part of me is worried that the game-play might get old and repetitive if the game were to be much longer. A new element would probably have to be added to keep things fresh. Personally I think the £15/$17 price is a bit steep considering the 2.5 hour play time, I got it on sale for about £6/$7 and I thought that was more reasonable (but I'm also quite cheap so...). Overall 8/10.
