ZygfrydQ
2,665 produits enregistrés
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
2.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 mars 2021
Produit reçu gratuitement

This game is... nuts?

Overview
NUTS is an adventure game where you are tasked with the surveillance of a group of squirrels inhabiting the Melmoth forest. Said squirrels are the last bastion of defense against the evil plans of a corporation, which wants to destroy the forest in order to get terrain to build on. Being the squirrels an endangered specie, you are tasked with tracking them and get the proof needed to stop the forest's destruction, but soon enough you'll start to notice very strange behaviours...

Squirrel Surveillance
Squirrel surveillance is not the easiest of tasks: the little creatures will in fact run around a lot before getting to their stashes and the fact that you can't follow them by foot makes it harder. Coming to your aid are three different cameras and monitors, that you can position around the map and will record a whole night of squirrel movements. While the squirrels' path will be the same each and every night, the fact that you only get three point of views makes it so you will need to repeatedly move the cameras around the find your objectives, which usually are the squirrels' stashes. Initially, the game plays in small maps to makes you accustomed with the system, which offers an unique gameplay to say the least, increasing the size of the pieces of forest you'll find yourself in when you'll be accustomed with the game.

All in all, that's the main gameplay loop in NUTS: move a camera, follow the squirrel until it goes out of sight, move the camera the next day to have a better view or to follow him. A gameplay loop that could become really boring really quickly. Luckily, the differentiation of the maps and the mistery behind the story will keep you playing through the whole game... which isn't a whole lot of time! For the base price of 16.79€, I would've expected more than only two and a half hours of gameplay that hardly introduces many new mechanics to differentiate, making the game very pricey in my opinion.

A Different Story
NUTS repetitive gameplay loop is articulated by its story: you are a researcher sent to the Melmoth forest to study an endangered specie of squirrels, which could be the only thing between the forest and the plans of a corp to build Panorama, a project which would destroy the ecosystem. Each level of the game asks you to take photographs of the squirrels' stashes, in order to confirm their presence in the area and thus stopping the construction plans. This seems very normal, until you find a stash that, between the heaps of nuts, has some dinamyte. From there the story gets more misterious and you'll find yourself wondering about the squirrels' behaviours more and more.

While the story starts off great, the ending is very lacking and (without making any spoilers) I really expected something more. In the end, a game like this should have an interesting story with an incredible ending, which is not the case here.

Graphics
The first thing you'll notice about NUTS isn't its squirrel surveillance gameplay or its story, but its beautiful and rather strange graphical direction. Every level will in fact used two different color palettes, one for day time and one for night time, with every object having almost monochromatic textures, making for beautiful vistas even in simple environments. This also allow to recognize the squirrels among the vegetation, since they will always have colors that stand out from the environment, something that would've been hard to do with a more "realistic" approach to graphics.

Unfortunately, even the graphical compartment of NUTS isn't without faults: in this case I have to signal a rather unstable framerate that moved between the 40 and 60 fps. Not really the best for a game with such simple graphics.

Verdict
NUTS is a game with a really interesting art direction, interesting mechanics (that could however have been expanded more) and an overall lacking story, expecially in the ending. The low playtime with no replayability, when confronted with the asking price, makes me recommend this game only under a very heavy (75%) discount.

Visit SaveOrQuit.com for detailed game reviews, posted daily!

6.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 octobre 2023
I generally like photography and slow methodological games, and nuts is it. Putting you in the role of a naturalist documenting squirrels in a reserve threatened by corporate greed, you have to capture these illusive rodents through careful placement of cameras which will test your observation and pattern identification skills. The story line isn't anything out of the ballpark but still compelling enough as you go through your assignments. And whatever it is, squirrels are cute and fuzzy. Short but challenging enough not to frustrate anyone to rage quit.
 
kervinchong

2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Recommandé
3.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 mai 2021
Produit reçu gratuitement

Да это ж игра, созданная для меня! Детективная история про белок, в которой надо расставлять видеокамеры! Идеально.
Сюжет забавный. История раскрылась не так эпично, как в определенные моменты казалось: вроде нагнетают, нагнетают, а по сути сюжет оказался камерным. Но концовка в целом порадовала, мило, с легкой-легкой долей безумия. И с БЕЛОЧКАМИ.
Геймплей мне тоже очень понравился. Днем расставляем камеры, ночью смотрим, что они отсняли, прикидываем, по какому маршруту бегают белки, корректируем расстановку. Нам дают разные задачи: то найти, откуда белка прибежала, то отследить все точки ее маршрута, то даже в реальном времени за ней побегать без камеры. Не надоедает.
Довольно большой минус – только графика. В данном случае минимализм прохождению не мешает, как было в Return of the Obra Dinn, но красивой игру не назовешь. Хотелось атмосферы леса, и к тому же, на паре уровней цветовые сочетания сильно напрягали глаза.
9/10
Vidéo YouTube™: Say No! More и NUTS 
Vues : 99
Стримы проходят здесь: http://www.twitch.tv/zhem/ Мой книжный канал: https://www.youtube.com/c/Zhem/
 
Zhem
678 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
2.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 novembre 2021
The game really draws you in, Firewatch style. It presents a basic, nature-watch story that quickly turns sinister. Then, it puts you in a B-plot, resolves the B-plot, and ends the game. The main story, what happens to the other characters, and the whole purpose of the first 2 thirds of the game just get flushed down the drain.
Not to mention I stumbled upon the end of the path for the final puzzle before the rest of it, so I never figured out on my own what you're supposed to do. The character never picks up on it, and what's set up kind of defies the logic it presents, so I had to look up a walkthrough just to beat the game. There isn't really a lot of logic behind why you do what gets you out, and it has nothing to do with the presented objective. I never would have guessed you're supposed to jump into the river at that specific point. I kept trying to find out where up the mountain the squirrels go. The main objective is to figure that out and get your journal back, after all.
Imagine an escape room where you stumble upon the button that unlocks the main door out immediately by accident. You press it, nothing obvious happens, and you assume it must be to something else. Then you solve the main puzzles up to where you get the to the button, and don't realize the button went to the main door, and that the door was unlocked. You'd be stuck forever.
Even if you ignore that oversight, the fact that the story sets up so much so well and resolves nothing makes the game really not worth playing. In the end you haven't really done anything.

To compare it to Firewatch again, imagine if in Firewatch, after you get knocked out, you wake up in a ravine. After you escape the situation you're in, the helicopter picks you up and the credits roll. No dialogue, you just leave and the game ends. That's pretty much what happens here. I mean what even happened to Simon? He disappears like he's been captured or worse, and the game just forgets about him?
Really it feels like the story team quit 2 thirds of the way into the game, and they just kinda had to cobble an ending together asap.
 
Saugan
1,231 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 avril 2021
Produit reçu gratuitement

Recently I had a game that I was excited for. A game that might seem similar to this even. Mysterious woods, investigating, a story that's mostly narrated and so on... and wow, it turned out to be a massive disappointment. I thought that perhaps I was too excited and ruined the game. In comes NUTS and I'm even more excited. But this time it was not a disappointment. It was in fact a very lovely experience.

Visually this game's simple, yet really thought out. The colors invert based on night and day and each area has its own color scheme. They all look good, though at times it was very bright and a bit heavy on the eyes. I'm using a monitor with good colors though, so maybe on a TN panel the colors feel less vivid and this problem might not exist. Everything's easy to understand.

The gameplay is simple and streamlined, yet still engaging. The bulk of the game has you tracking squirrel movements. Set up cams during the day, evaluate recordings during the night. You snap from day to night in an instant when you want to move on and it's just perfect for keeping a brisk pace. Your movement's also not restricted at all. If you manage to climb a rock and set up a camera at a vantage point, then you can do it. No invisible walls, no linearity.

The story is compelling, but sadly nothing gets answered. Like seriously, nothing. Not even a single thing. This is like Act 1 of a longer story. I felt like I was half-way compelled into the story, waiting for the mysteries to get cranked up and focused on a bit more, only for it to just... end. Literally some of the stakes set up were pretty big too and them getting left to the dust seems almost comically ridiculous. What's there is great. Just that hearing that there's a mystery, seeing weird things and having it end with no payoff is a bit disappointing.

But honestly, regardless of that I enjoyed it. The squirrels are so cute and genuinely adorable to watch when they're doing their thing. The mystery being built is enjoyable, if you're ready to be left in the lurch with no answers. It's charming, to put it mildly.

This game made me remember that expecting a game to be good isn't some insane request.
 
Zeruel

tiny_potato
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
8.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 juin 2023
Completed with 100% of achievements unlocked. While photography-based games are becoming something of an expanding niche, NUTS's premise as a "squirrel surveillance" game is still an intriguing one. The game tasks the player with tracking squirrels' night-time movements across a series of forest areas with strategically-placed cameras, with an environmentalist story providing some narrative drive. While fairly simple, this mechanic works pretty well, with a couple of minor twists - though the later scenarios (there are six) do start to show its limits, as with their longer length the downtime between placing cameras (via first-person exploration), watching back the recorded footage, repositioning and repeating becomes evident - the traipse to and from the caravan observation point becomes increasingly tedious, adding little to the gameplay (though the inclusion of "walking simulator" in the game's official description does, I suppose, give fair warning of this). Overall, NUTS is decent while it lasts (somewhere around 3 hours), but I can't see it sustaining an experience that's much longer than that.
 
Illusionary
4,320 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
7.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 février 2023
Welcome to peeping tom nature edition. You are a private investigator sent to uncover the seedy underbelly of the rabid squirrel population and take photos of their nefarious crimes to blackmail them. But be careful. Your boss will gaslight you at every turn as she never lets you talk. It's all about her feelings.

In all seriousness, this is a remarkably entertaining game, given its simplicity and repetitiveness. Virtual nature is as relaxing and therapeutic as the real thing. An hour will go by, and you won't even know it. The story and gameplay take some interesting turns on your journey. While the ending is abrupt, you can infer what happens based on the credits and what Nina said.

There are no manual saves, but each chapter should take about 30 to 45 minutes, depending on how good you are at using a GPS and placing cameras. The key is to think like a squirrel.

There are a few quirky bugs, like you can answer the phone from the fax machine or your bed with the world's longest arm. The trailer door will automatically close when you answer the phone. I suppose it's a ghost, a squirrel, or the wind. It closed the door when I was outside on the phone, so the cord must go through the door. I found the bugs charming, though.

I recommend it, but only on sale because $20 is a bit steep for a walking simulator.
 
graphixela
1,720 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 octobre 2022
Very cute game! Love the graphics and unique gameplay! Your job is to fulfill certain tasks by investigating squirells and tracking their moves throughout the nights by deploying cameras. The are a few games with similar gameplay but NUTS still managed to be unique in its own way. The gamplay loop of placing cameras, watching the recording, moving cameras, watching the recording, etc is sometimes a bit too repetitive and annoying, especially when you have to walk a good bit from your trailer to where your cameras are but it's not too bad as to sour the game.

I personally also loved the story, even though it is a very generic "evil companies are destroying nature" storyline. The game provides a nice mix of story, gameplay, cute animals, puzzle, exploration, as well as excitement and certain calming elements.

I can only recommend you try NUTS for yourself! Maybe do pick it up on sale though because for 3 hours of gameplay the game is rather short :)

I do wish it had been longer though, I don't feel like they got all out of the concept that they could have. There is definitely room for more levels with more "puzzles" and more story. None the less, I was thoroughly entertained for the 3-4 hours the game took. If they create a sequel I'll definitely play it.

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
4.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 février 2021
Produit reçu gratuitement

My friend bought me this game for my birthday, and I loved it. The puzzle of the game is incredibly unique and interesting to think through. I'd compare this mostly closely to Return of the Obra Dinn: Incredible (stylized) graphics, an interesting puzzle with open-ended solving. The game also has a great ability to build suspense despite being a game where you walk alone in a forest, where the scariest thing out there for you to find are some squirrels, tapes, and a guitar.

The only other character, Nina Scholz, is also a lovely presence. She really carries the kind-hearted tone of the game while being delightfully German (Ihr, Deutscher, koennt nicht "Eichhoernchen" auf Englisch sagen - aber ist okay, weil ich "einhoernchen" nicht so gut sagen kann)

I only have 2 complaints:

1) There is no "skip to night" option, you always have to walk yourself back to the campsite. This is just a nitpick, but it's the most tedious part of the game because of how much backtracking there is just to hit "record" on the VCR and progress to the nighttime parts.

2) The ending completely abandons the storyline, and I went from wondering how everything will turn out to the game suddenly being over. I understand it's an environmental message regarding the dam construction and whatnot, but there was implied murder and corruption and you can't just not give the player closure on that
 
Pogostix

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
2.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 janvier 2023
Как любителю игры Jazzpunk и прочих необычных, в своей стилистике игр, мне посчастливилось наткнуться на эту игру.
Посмотрев на своеобразный стиль графики и необычную задумку игры, я не раздумывая купила её.

Игра - короткая, на один вечер, однако она полностью погружает вас в геймплей.
Вы - исследуете белок, и всё, что вам нужно делать - это следить за ними по трём имеющимся у вас камерам, однако камеры вы ставите сами, и каждую ночь просматриваете то, что наснимали.

Сюжет, конечно, немного дырявый. Концовка открытая, непонятная. Однако если вы такой же любитель цветастой графики, необычной задумки, и интересного, ни на что не похожего геймплея - тогда вперёд, белки уже ждут вас!
 
SpecialPlayer!
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 décembre 2022
This game is OK. The visuals and sound are nice. The gameplay is relaxing, but nothing extraordinary. Basically, use tripod cameras to track squirrels from point A to point B.

A couple of spots, including near the end, the developers bring several identical squirrels into frame and they wrestle in a tight ball, leaving you unable to determine which squirrel is the one you are supposed to follow....so you guess and follow one after the other until you guess correctly. I found that annoying, particularly because you can't save mid-mission. So, you might expect a 15-20 minute mission but if you guess wrong, you could be looking at 30-40 minutes. That's a lot to ask for a chill relaxing indie game IMO.

流程较短的小品级作品
剧情演出上让我联想到了著名的步行模拟器Firewatch，而本作其实也只是在步行模拟器的基础上套了浅层的游戏玩法。但值得夸赞的地方是游戏的渲染风格的确是为游戏玩法服务的且这一点执行的很出色。

Recommandé
3.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 juillet 2021
This is a pleasantly relaxing game. I would suggest going in blind as far as the story goes, but the basic gameplay mechanic is a trial-and-error effort to track down squirrels to take pictures. It is not a big-time action game, but the story is nice and the reduced color pallet of the environments invites your brain to fill in the details. The two-tone forest felt more real to me than a lot of pixelated leaf textures. I beat the whole game and got 100% of the achievements in three hours. Whether that bugs you or not is a matter of preference.

eternality
2,828 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
9.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 mai 2021
It's a good game, a little short (I paused a lot so my playtime isn't really accurate, it probably would've been more like 5-6 hours), but pretty and compelling. However it has one glaring flaw:

NO REMAPPABLE CONTROLS.

You cannot change the keybinds, which is very frustrating if you're left-handed like me. I had to awkwardly reach over to WSAD with my right hand for the entire game. Arrow keys work, but when you need to use left-shift to run and Space to jump, they're not really an option. I can also see it being a problem for people who are disabled and need specific keybinds to be able to play. In 2021, especially for a game made in Unity which has innumerable tutorials, this is an utterly baffling and inexcusable decision. It has been inexcusable for years.

Also, some plot decisions are weird and vague and the ending is what I would describe as open-ended, so if that is something that bothers you in your games, you might want to avoid this. I'm still wondering (ENDGAME SPOILERS) what happened to Simon, and what the deal with the dynamite was. Why were there matches? Why would you light dynamite with a short fuse with matches? And are we supposed to assume Simon died from the bridge collapsing? That's awfully grim.

But overall it's very pretty and atmospheric and a relaxing way to spend a few hours. The camera gameplay is fun and doesn't overstay its welcome. I hope to see more games from these developers.
 
hatchet enjoyer

Évaluation publiée le 27 avril 2021
Super-cute and weirdly-addictive squirrel surveillance game that feels like a love letter to Firewatch whilst bringing alot of neat new ideas to the table. The art style and audio are beautiful - emphasising the relaxing yet mysterious vibe of the forest - but my favourite aspect of the game was playing around with the various bits of tech you have at your disposal. It feels very nice to play, with a great sense of mystery throughout and a wonderful lead voice actress and story to spur you forward. Lovely stuff.

TheShiBibble
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 février 2021
Fun little indie game with really good production quality. Graphics/art style, audio, level design etc are all done to a really high standard.

Intriguing story, but don't expect to feel stunned or in tears at the end of it. The gameplay is good but would mainly recommend for those with a bit more patience, experience in these kinda games, or a quiet night off, as it can feel a little repetitive or frustrating if you're not in the right mindset.

The pricetag is maybe a bit too steep at £15 in the UK. I don't mind what I spent because it means supporting indie devs like this, but the game is roughly 2-5hrs long which is pretty short. A sale of 30% off and I would definitely recommend this to others. Think you can play for £5ish on iOS.

Score: 8/10 (6 or 7 if squirrels don't appeal to you)
 
Midknut

catching squirrels in 4k.

pro intellectual
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 février 2021
Вариация на тему "Поезд шёл из пункта А в пункт Б" и ваша задача найти пункт Б. И только один раз придется ответить на вопрос: "А где сейчас находится поезд?"

Содержательная часть:
Сюжет: Игра проходится буквально за 2-3 часа, почти как фильм посмотреть. Цена тоже соответствует билету в кино, но в отличие от кино, сюжет тут ну очень скудный. Можно даже сказать, что в этой игре как будто только половина сюжета: с интригой, завязкой и т.п. а вторую часть сюжета оставили на потом, на вторую часть игры. Есть некие пасхалки в виде кассет для диктофона, но и они встречаются буквально раза 3-4 и толком ничего не поясняют.
Персонажи: Есть только вы, белки и 2 призрачных персонажа, с одним из которых мы общаемся, звоня по телефону через факс (ну вот так), а второй лишь оставляет нам записки.
Новизна: Игра в некотором роде напоминает игру "Don't feed the monkeys", так что тема слежки не нова, но подача оригинальна. Игра затягивает, но, не успев начаться, тут же заканчивается.
В целом за содержательную часть можно поставить 5/10.

Оформление:
Графика: Рисовка, безусловно, оригинальная и впечатляет на первый взгляд, но со временем, если бы игра длилась дольше, глаза начнут сильно уставать, поэтому спасибо разработчикам, что достаточно часто меняют цветовые пары.
Музыка: Хорошие звуки природы и приятное звуковое сопровождение событий, на фоне собственных шагов слышно и внешнее окружение, включая даже мелкие детали.
Интерфейс: Максимально простое управление, быстро привыкаешь, а если что-то и забыл, то есть ненавязчивые подсказки, очень удобно и минималистично.
За оформление можно поставить 9/10.

Механика:
Геймплей: Простой, но затягивающий геймплей, проработано как управление камерами, так и последующий анализ записей с них. Ничего лишнего.
Реиграбельность: К сожалению перед нами одноразовая игра, хотя есть огромный потенциал. Даже банальное введение дополнительных карт с случайной генерацией мира, что уж очень распространено давно, а еще добавление режима, где нужно на время или за ограниченное число дней вычислить куда убегает белка, сильно бы повысило реиграбельность, она бы появилась. Естественно ни о каком разнообразии сложности тут речи не идёт.
Суммарно за механику игры я бы поставил 6/10

Дополнительно: Багов в игре я не встретил.

Итого за игру 6.6/10, в неё можно поиграть, но я бы не стал её рекомендовать.

Recommandé
4.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 juillet 2021
Highly stylized mystery thriller that takes you on a journey to photograph squirrels and their nut stashes.

This game hooked me right out off the bat with its relaxing atmosphere, sound design, and general feel with its unique art style. The ending (with no spoilers) was a bit more open and probably added a few more questions instead of answering any. That isn't necessarily a bad thing though, I still felt satisfied even with that open ended-ness, it felt more appropriate for the game to end that way instead of knowing exactly what happened/what will happen. You could easily complete it in only one sitting, and I wish that I could experience this game again with a fresh mind!

Évaluation publiée le 26 avril 2021
This is a great game that uses a game mechanic that is often unused. The use of the colors and music combined with the narrative helps to give the player a feeling of "I'm going to see something disturbing right now, ain't I?". Its a feeling that was enjoyable and keeps you wanting to find out more. Unfortunately, the is a bit short. But if the devs add a few more chapters, in which they totally can as the story felt like it stopped too short and there were questions left unanswered, then this would be a solid indy game.

Cute little game, I love the style.
It was a lot of fun and quite satisfying when you get the photos right!

Only thing I can criticize, I wish Nina had more lines. I sent a certain photo of something that was obviously out of place and Nina just told me to get on with it... Nina, this thing could be very harmful to us!
But other than that, it's all positive from here. :)

*Slight spoiler*
Okay so I now get why some people are a bit miffed at the ending as it leaves it up to your imagination of what happens afterwards. Either that or it's a hook for Nuts 2

Évaluation publiée le 10 octobre 2021
NUTS is the best game I have ever played. My life was in shambles before I bought this game, but NUTS has changed my life for the better. Seeing those little squirrels squirreling around for the first time is an experience that I will never be able to relive. This is genuinely the best game of this generation, maybe even ever. Games like The Last of Us, God of War, Red Dead Redemption have nothing on the world building, and rich atmosphere that is NUTS. When the credits started rolling, I burst out in tears. Tears of happiness. Thank you NUTS.

LizardScript
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 mai 2021
Short and sweet, innovative gameplay and very atmospheric!

Very Firewatch with a hint of Scanner Sombre, you're on your own in the forest with a mission to track the nocturnal habits of some squirrels, luckily they follow the same routes every night so with the aid of some trusty cameras, night by night you move your equipment around to follow their routes home

Some will find the gameplay repetitive by the end but I really enjoyed it, it kept it fresh and mixed up what was required of you every so often and the narrative moments are woven in beautifully

A large part of me wished it turned into something darker, an actual conspiracy, the squirrels really are out to get you, or a betrayal as Nina or Simon turn out to be working for the enemy and must be thwarted.. the atmosphere and build up really suited that kind of twist but this is good too
 
Nert
2,491 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 février 2021
By it for on sale!

The price of 15€ is on the edge on this. I really digged the gameplay and the squirrels. The story felt for the most part nice, but leaves an empty taste behind. It feels like there could have been way more. Since there is an obvious inspiration of games like Firewatch, I wonder why there isn't more to it? The end is... a great scenery, but I felt like I did something wrong and got... almost the bad ending. It just left too many questions unanswered. I wouldn't have any problem, if this game changed the gameplay at the end for the sake of telling a deeper story. The story felt best after chapter 5, but that's also way too short. Also it baits a lot into a mystic direction, but hardly goes that way. That felt like a letdown as well.

I still recommend it, if you can buy it with a discount. It's not bad, a nice experience, I had fun, but it's on the short site after all.

3.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 aout 2021
Very nice artstyle, the main mechanic is new and has some interesting variations, but not enough to keep it from getting tedious by the end.
The story starts interesting and keep me hooked, but it ends up not resolving any of the plot points, and just ends in a very vague pro-environmentalism message.

Would not recommend it, unless you want to feel frustrated with a story that seems to go somewhere, and the just doesn’t.
 
Kazenoyari
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
10.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 juillet 2023
Produit reçu gratuitement

As I played through Nuts, I found myself captivated by the question of what these squirrels were up to. The game tells a tightly written tale that reaches a satisfying conclusion without taking too many risks. While the gameplay revolves around positioning cameras to track the squirrels' movements, it doesn't evolve much beyond that. However, what Nuts does exceptionally well is its sense of style. The visually striking art design and minimalistic use of colors create a captivating atmosphere. The audio design also adds to the experience, with the forest sounds transitioning to a sense of eerie silence at night. The story unfolds as you aid the research efforts of Viago University and uncover the mystery of the forest. While the gameplay may become repetitive, Nuts is still a relaxing and intriguing puzzle adventure with a strong ecological message. It's a great escape into a lush forest and the secrets it holds.

Curator Page: https://steamcommunity.com/groups/Kenstagator/curation
 
Kenstagator
2,214 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 aout 2022
Un juego visual y auditivamente placentero
-
La estética y dirección artística de este juego es muy muy bonita, tiene sus problemas claro, como el no poder entender bien la profundidad de ciertas partes, zonas, o estructuras (Muchas paredes o rocas no sabía donde comenzaban o si realmente eran lo que eran).
La música que acompaña al juego va como anillo al dedo, es relajante pero lo suficientemente atrapante para entrenerte sin aburrirte.
El diseño de los niveles es interesante, los mapas a veces se sienten un poco más grandes de lo que realmente son pero de buena manera, la mecánica de grabar a las ardillas durante la noche me ha parecido genial y muy entretenida.
Me tomó 3 horas terminar el juego, aunque puedo entender por qué a muchos otros les tomaría mucho más tiempo (He visto gente que les tomó de 5 a 8 horas terminarlo).
La queja que muchos tienen de que la historia es floja y el final malo, es simplemente porque no entienden el juego y por sobre todo, por alguna razón, casi nadie entiende el final, así que haré spoilers adelante.
SPOILERS:
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
Así que, perdimos, más de 30 años de investigación de Nina, su lucha interminable contra las corporaciones para proteger ese habitat natural que era hogar de las ardillas y seguramente más animales, proteger un ecosistema de un lugar tan lindo que de hecho era visitado por turistas, pero nada se pudo hacer, la corporación villana (no recuerdo el nombre) jugó sucio, tenía el poder, el dinero, y los contactos, la gente pequeña no puede contra los gigantes, y terminamos ♥♥♥ la aplastante revelación de que a fin de cuentas, no importaba qué hicieramos, el destino del lugar ya estaba sellado, la tala de arboles y contaminación del bosque provocó una inundación descomunal PORQUE ESO ES EL FINAL, ESTAMOS FLOTANDO, EN EL BARCO, POR SOBRE TODO EL BOSQUE A LA ALTURA DE LAS COPAS DE LOS ARBOLES, PIENSEN LA CANTIDAD DE AGUA QUE SE NECESITA PARA ESO. Quedamos flotando mientras las ardillas nos acompañan, mirando y observando su hogar, ahora destruido. Simon murió, no lo dicen directamente pero queda medio explicito en el juego, él siempre hablaba de quejarse sobre el puente que debe cruzar en su cuatriciclo que era muy viejo y endeble, que algún día alguien se lastimaría, eventualmente el día llegó y el que lo pagó fue él, durante el final vemos su cuatriciclo flotar, y detrás de él, una caja en las que él trae las cámaras. Lo peor es que seguramente taparan su muerte culpando al inundamiento, y no sólo eso, es muy probable que su cuerpo ni siquiera sea encontrado jamás.
Admito que terminé llorando ♥♥♥ el final del juego, entender el mensaje y lo importante que es, que estas cosas pasan constantemente todo el tiempo en todo el mundo, y que a pesar de nuestros efuerzos y encariñamiento ♥♥♥ las criaturas del bosque nunca tuvimos oportunidad de hacer nada, perder de esa forma y ver la destrucción del lugar en el que vivimos por días, en el que nos encariñamos, en el que mirabamos a las pequeñas ardillas simplemente vivir y ver como se comportaban... Fue duro...
Personalmente, considero que es un juego que podría pulirse mucho más, sobre todo en el apartado de la actuación de voz y ciertos aspectos visuales, pero es un juego que la gran mayoría debería jugar aunque sea una vez en su vida, y que se les tenga que meter la cuchara en la boca explicandoles el final ya que por alguna razón, como ya dije, casi nadie parece entender.
 
EMBT
328 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Non recommandé
0.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 novembre 2021
NUTS, in inglese, significa noccioline, ma è (tra le altre cose) anche parte di una domanda retorica ♥♥♥ cui si chiede all'interlocutore se non si sia bevuto il cervello; proprio quel tipo di esclamazione che ci verrebbe da fare ai cinque sviluppatori che non hanno nemmeno trovato un nome sotto il quale identificarsi. Non stiamo parlando del remake dello shooter pubblicato per Atari 2600 nei primi anni Ottanta (per quanto, come vedremo più avanti, non manchino omaggi al decennio dei paninari), né del porting dell'omonimo runner qualche tempo fa per piattaforme mobile (in quel caso nel titolo c'era anche il punto esclamativo), quanto piuttosto di un seguito spirituale, anche se concettualmente diverso, dell'indie Firewatch, a cui si avvicina per atmosfere rilassanti e meccaniche estremamente lineari. Sarà anche questo un piccolo gioiello? Scopriamolo nella nostra recensione.

Uno studente universitario accetta di trascorrere qualche settimana all'interno del parco naturalistico Melmoth per studiare usi e costumi degli scoiattoli. Appena arrivati al camper che fungerà da rifugio e base operativa, sorge il dubbio che ci si possa trovare di fronte ad un thriller sulla falsariga del recente This is the Zodiac Speaking, ♥♥♥ cui NUTS condivide lo stile grafico (e anche l'engine: si parla pur sempre di Unity), spingendo però al massimo sul pedale del minimalismo. Una musica inquietante che accompagna i primi e basilari compiti (mettere in moto il generatore, spedire un fax), unita alla voce fuori campo della professoressa Nina Scholz che ci istruisce via fono, sembrerebbe fare da preludio ad un'avventura ricca di pathos e salti sulla sedia. Il registro cambia una volta arrivati nella foresta, dove si scopre che l'unico obbiettivo è quello di catturare gli sfuggenti roditori in momenti topici della loro intimità (niente scene hot): mentre mangiano, oppure mentre costruiscono una nuova tana. Non si tratta solo di soddisfare la fame di conoscenza dell'insaziabile cricca degli etologi, ma dietro a questo elettrizzante progetto c'è uno scopo più nobile: dimostrare come gli adorabili sgranocchiatori di noccioline, specie considerata a rischio di estinzione, sarebbero destinati a rimanere impressi solo sulle pagine di Focus, qualora la spietata impresa edile Panorama riuscisse ad ottenere il permesso di costruire un resort tanto lussuoso quanto dannoso per l'ecosistema. Purtroppo, l'attrezzatura a disposizione dello squattrinato dottorando è la stessa che utilizzava Folco Quilici una quarantina d'anni fa, e contempla delle sgranatissime videocamere termiche, un paio di CRT dalla dubbia provenienza e un GPS che probabilmente stona un po' nel contesto, ma senza il quale la spedizione rischierebbe di durare ben più delle poche settimane che l'università Viago è disposta a sovvenzionare per salvare i codoni degli scoiattoli.

La routine è la seguente: si esce dalla roulotte, si posizionano i due treppiedi (ma nel prosieguo diventeranno tre) in punti potenzialmente strategici della foresta, spostandoli uno alla volta (purtroppo il nostro alter ego dev'essere un po' gracile), si torna alla base e si preme il tasto REC nell'avanzatissimo quadro comandi. Arrivata la sera (per fortuna non occorre attendere ore) ci si piazza davanti ai monitor per vedere se gli sfuggenti animaletti sono stati catturati da uno dei nostri occhi nella notte. Si torna fuori, si spostano le videocamere nei punti in cui si pensa che i diavoletti abbiano proseguito il proprio percorso sino ad arrivare all'obbiettivo finale richiesto dalla professoressa. Capite da voi come questo porti ad un backtracking all'ennesima potenza, reso lievemente meno drammatico da un level design che non lascia spazio a fronzoli e da una certa contenutezza delle mappe. Per arrivare più rapidamente allo scopo ci si può aiutare ♥♥♥ dei torsoli di mela o dei rotoli di carta igienica (materiali ovviamente biodegradabili) che fungono da riferimenti visivi, essendo, come tutti gli oggetti ♥♥♥ cui si può interagire, colorati in arancio fluorescente. Per il resto la palette di NUTS vi spingerà a chiedervi se per caso non abbiate abilitato la modalità a 256 colori, visto che la foresta è messa in scena ♥♥♥ delle silhouette quasi monocromatiche, dove a farla da padrone sono dei rilassanti toni pastello. La colonna sonora, a parte la furbata iniziale, è perfettamente in sintonia ♥♥♥ il design e la voce sexy-rilassante della professoressa Sholz, interpretata da Charlene "Charl" Putney, già al lavoro su Baldur's Gate 3, la classica ciliegina sulla torta.

In fondo lo scopo di questo Death Stranding low-cost è proprio quello di trascinare nel mood zen i giocatori più intellettuali, quelli per cui il videogioco deve essere un passatempo, nel senso letterale della parola. È altrettanto chiaro che anche per una simile fetta di utenza (forse più facilmente individuabile tra gli utilizzatori di Nintendo Switch, l'unica console per cui è attualmente previsto il porting) i meccanismi sin troppo basilari e ripetitivi di NUTS potrebbero venire presto a noia; consapevoli di questo rischio, gli sviluppatori hanno deciso di limitare la durata della storia a circa quattro o cinque ore. Un limite di tempo che potrebbe essere comunque eccessivo per il giocatore medio, che difficilmente troverà la voglia di cliccare una terza volta sull'icona a forma di scoiattolo. Un indie che basa la sua ragion d'essere su una singola meccanica di gioco senza arricchirla ♥♥♥ significative variazioni che garantiscano un aumento della varietà. La risultante è un titolo che potrebbe piacere a chi cerca un passatempo rilassante, ma che nel complesso non riesce a raggiungere la sufficienza.
 
Digital Boy

Non recommandé
3.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 aout 2021
A lovely game with an interesting premise but fails to provide any closure and departs from the original theme of "what are the squirrels doing?".
The game simply ends with no answers to the squirrels behaviour or any answers to what happened with the shady corporations and Nina.

Fun to play but forgets to finish its own story leaving you unsatisfied.

Évaluation publiée le 6 février 2021
Nuts is a touching and political work of art that invites you to question how you see nature and biodiversity in a very sensitive way, with an innovative gameplay of camera placement. Graphics and OST give the game an eery and beautiful atmosphere.
Nust is also a very good product in terms of design. It's fluid and fun to play with just the good amount of challenge.

Évaluation publiée le 9 octobre 2022
It's a slow game and that's fine. The gameplay loop revolves around setting up caneras and following the path of squirrels in a nature reserve.

The style is unique and enjoyable. The reason I don't recommend it is because the game becomes tedious before the story is told.

In the third act, the assignment becomes particularly tedious and I watched how the game played out in a let's play instead.
 
harlekein
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Non recommandé
2.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 octobre 2022
This could have been enjoyable IF almost everything about this game were different. The concept is interesting! The gameplay could have been enjoyable! IF the whole thing didn't look like some kind of vaporwave migraine. For a game that's all about seeing things, it's remarkably hard just to look at: it's all rendered in flat silhouettes of pink and purple such that almost everything, regardless of location or perspective, looks the same. The camera view pans sickeningly and the angle of the field of view seems to have been chosen for minimum utility and maximum confusion. As the lurid mauve cherry on top of this retch-inducing cake, it's impossible to take a break from this game as it only saves at the end of chapters, so you can't even parcel out the suffering into smaller doses. In short -- I dislike this game extremely for its affectations and impediments to play, but I hate it because it really could have been something new and delightful.
 
piraterie
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
6.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 septembre 2023
Great concept but absolutely horrible color palette for most of the time, hard on the eyes. Took me about 50 mins to figure out I was printing screenshots from the wrong monitor (yes, I did read the instruction book by the door). Also took me some fiddling to find where my photos were stored and how to access them in order to fax them. Took me around 90 mins to realize I could jump. Overall the controls are not very intuitive, and they are not explained in the controls menu.

The gameplay of following squirrels movements via cameras is inspired, I give it that, and I loved that “scientific” aspect of it. I'd love more games that have you be a nature photographer, scientist or researcher of this sort. But further along it gets pretty tedious since they are very easy to lose track of. And at one point late in the game you're even meant to more or less make a leap of faith into something that the game has taught you is no way to progress. The story is progressively intriguing but leaves a lot, if not everything, actually, hanging in the air by the end.

376 produits enregistrés

2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
2.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 mars 2021
森林浴しながら日中にカメラ数個設置して業務終了、
夜中に1分弱の映像確認して寝るだけのアルバイトが出来るゲーム。現実にもくれ。

電話でニーナ博士から指示を受けながら、
リスの生態を追うため、カメラを設置してリスを撮影していく。
調査を進めていく内、森を壊して行われるダム建設を強行する証拠が見つかり…といったお話。
実はリスの正体は…みたいなジャンルの話ではないのでご注意。

ストーリーとしてはそれほど起伏もなくSF的な広がりを見せる話でもないが、
操作性もよく写真撮影・送信などのアクションが子気味良く、
2~3時間で飽きる前にサクッと終わるゲームなので、PVの雰囲気好き～ってなったら買って、
他のゲームに疲れた時の箸休め程度にプレイするのを推奨する。
 
sirataki
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 avril 2022
1，价格不太合理，因为游戏流程较短
2，繁简中好评
3，形式上来说，游戏机制十分有创新，第一人称与第四人称的结合颇有炫技
4，叙事体例上来说，其较为重视对于叙事的阈限阶段的人类学重构，尤其是松鼠的每天晚上的路径将整个游戏基调的阈限场域划分开来，这是一种讨巧的做法
5，反馈上来说，三维已经够晕了，还要加这种Unity大红大紫的卡通着色器，我踏马直接喷射
6，政治性上来说，作者对于资本主义本义的理解还是处于一个比较初级的阶段，当然这可能是为舞台叙事留有余地的做法罢

Still, not the worst game I ever played and if you're achievement hunting you can 100% this game in less 3 hours.

duswn1136
29 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 février 2021
Sheesh.

The game had me always asking questions, always wondering about something. And just when I think I have everything figured out, It flips me on my head. This game in both artstyle, and gameplay, is a marvel. With unique gameplay and a one-of-a-kind art style, NUTS kept me guessing through my whole playtime.

However this game is VERY short. It took me about 2.3 hours to get to the credits. And I understand why it's short, the primary development team consists of 5 or 6 people. So I understand that there is a reason for the short length and high-quality, but damn, can't say I wouldn't have enjoyed it if the game was 5 or 10 hours.


All in all, NUTS is a fantastic game with great ideas executed flawlessly, a fresh take on the surveillance idea of singleplayer games.

Évaluation publiée le 31 mars 2022
I really wanted to like this but honestly the gameplay is so boring that I just can't. I'm going to return it actually. The art style is cool and I'm interested in the storyline but having to go and place cameras, watch the footage at night, re-place the cameras, watch the footage at night, ad nauseum, is just so boring. It feels like a chore. And I like walking sims! Nuts seems to me to be trying to do what Firewatch did (which I loved), but the mechanics are just too boring to make it enjoyable. Sorry folks.

koeslter
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 novembre 2022
I thought it was fun! Really interesting art style, and the gameplay loop I thought was different and certainly kept my scattered brain's attention. The game reminded me heavily of the feeling I get when I'm in the woods back home. Soundtrack is top notch too!

I think it would've been neat if you could post a camera up and watch some of Panorama's shenanigans in the woods, and get them in trouble but hey, the squirrels were more than enough. Some things felt out of place and felt like they needed more explanation, like the church area having a hum to it, but that could've just been for ease-of-play reasons. Idk, I say put aside a few hours and give it a shot!

The only issues I had were some framerate issues at the end of the game, but a quit to main menu and back solved it. This is probably from their custom shader "witchcraft" as they put it :^). That, and controls might've been slightly jank but once you get used it to it, I don't think it's too bad
 
Old R4sputin

Pros:
- stylish visuals;
- unique gameplay: tracking squirrels using cameras;
♥♥♥♥:
- gameplay is not very fun and is braindead simple;
- voiced narration happens only when you use phone, so when you explore or move cameras during day, nothing interesting is going on;
- plot is too simple, not very engaging and resolution is half-baked.

Game is 2-3 hours long which is short but avoids gameplay becoming too repetitive.

Would not recommend it for full price, may be worth checking for half the price.

6.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 juin 2021
"Maybe it's just not your genre". That's what I keep telling myself.

But I surely think that if your game is about nothing else but repetitive gameplay and a narrative, AT LEAST make the narrative something decent.
Oh no. Yet another "something is happening - it's an eViL cOrPoRaTiOn vs nAtuRe - we couldn't think of (or agree on) anything else beyond that so we'll just whatever our way to the end" story. Emotional investment: zero. Story content / believability : ridiculously close to nothing, and that is not counting the "strange/surreal" events. The study premisse alone is dumb. Incredibly annoying "let me interrupt your repetitive game with an oh look the sun is shining comment on a dictaphone tape" or "hey i just need you to listen to my unskippable phone monologues 24/7 and oh no they're going to get us all by DoCtOrInG an ArTiClE" whinery. Just let me chase another squirrel. Or rather, tediously replace cameras because just following them on foot would be to obvious - except in that one chapter when you suddenly have to run after them because whatever.
I mean come on, there's even typos in the name of the researcher character, using both Nona and Nina on the same memo page.
Total gameplay until the incredibly "i guess we really can't figure out an end so we'll just stop writing and cash in" ending: a mere 6.5 hours, of which 1 hour was lost due to bugs and navigating the menus in search of my previously saved game. This was a waste of money. I can't believe how artificially hyped this game is.

But hey, "maybe it's just not your genre"...
 
Pol Petrol
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
7.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 mai 2021
Produit reçu gratuitement

Прохождение:
Vidéo YouTube™: NUTS -1- БЕЛИЧИЙ СЛЕДОПЫТ [Прохождение на русском] 
Vues : 344
📌 Плейлист NUTS: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLyd3jy1EFI7Ia_ewmnUp_a96Jo2Lrynd- 👻 Страшные Истории на Ночь с Зоди: https://youtube.com/HorrorZodi 💘 Паблик ВК:...


Если кратко, то "NUTS" - это исследовательское приключение. Мы играем за работника организации по защите природы. Нас отправляют в лес, чтобы следить там за поведением белок. Для этого у нас есть необходимое оборудование - видеокамеры, мониторы, фотоаппарат, навигатор, диктофон (искать аудиозаписи), принтер (печатать фотографии), факс (получать задания и отправлять фотографии), дневник и, само собой, телефон. Жить мы будем в уютном фургончике, периодически меняя локации. Геймплей в основном состоит из того, что днем мы расставляем камеры, а ночью занимаемся слежкой. Это может показаться однообразным, но, благодаря разным локациям и поведению белок, это интересно. Кроме того, будут и другие активности, но не буду спойлерить. Сюжет в игре служит одной цели - обьяснить, зачем мы вообще этим всем занимаемся. Визуальный стиль необычный, но приятный, цветовая гамма игры будет периодически меняться. Звучит игра тоже хорошо. Управление удобное. Мне игра нравится, смело рекомендую.
 
PlayZodi
1,878 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
7.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 mars 2023
TLDR Review: If a walking sim about tracking squirrels sounds nice and you like the graphic layout based on the trailer, then this will likely be a decent break from more active gaming. Be aware, though, that tracking the squirrels is a hit or miss mechanic and the gameplay may get old fast. 6/10, barely thumbs up.

Review: Well, fuzzy little creatures sounded nice. With the bare bones color layout and almost night-scope vision of the forest, I thought this would be rather easy. It wasn’t. Tracking the animals paths was fun for the first hour or so, but then it became somewhat aggravating as I honestly could not guess where they would be headed next, which led to more of the same activity of squirrel tracking than I assumed would happen.

On one hand, this came off as the most interesting idea I’ve seen in a walking sim since I played “Everything”. On the other hand, by the second hour of tracking squirrels I was more than done. As a matter of fact, I just wanted *something* different to occur because the constant mission objective of finding a squirrel, guessing its path, and putting up cameras to look at the video just went on for much too long. The story elements helped, but at the same time never really played out the way I thought it would. I did enjoy learning about the doctor, your boss, but it’s all one-sided and your main character has no interaction beyond that other than some written notes in a journal. If you are looking for Firewatch Jr, this is not it.

Style-wise, I enjoyed the graphics. It’s not for everyone. While playing I did have a bit of trouble distinguishing areas with all the monochromatic graphics, but I doubt real looking trees and shrubs would have helped much either. At least the squirrels are easy to spot, just hard to catch and harder than expected to guess where they are heading next. I don’t think it was the difficulty that was off putting so much as I just got tired of the same squirrel tracking missions over and over.

The game ultimately ended well and if not for that I would have left a negative review. So, 6/10 for me. Grab on discount and play when you are not busy.
 
dangerhighdoltage
2,700 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
4.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 avril 2021
Produit reçu gratuitement

Guten Tag meine Lieben,

NUTS ist ein kleines süßes Spiel bei dem ihr die Aufgabe habt ein Eichhörnchen-Reservoir durch eine Dokumentation und Berichterstattung zu schützen, damit dort nicht ein 5 Sterne Luxus-Bums gebaut werden kann.

Das Spiel besteht im Großen und Ganzen darin Kameras aufzustellen, Fotos von den Eichhörnchen zu machen und diese dann an eure Auftragsgeberin zu faxen.

Die Grafik dieses Games ist in einer Comikgrafik gestaltet, welche in jedem Kapitel (es sind sechs an der Zahl) eine andere auffällige Farbgebung hat. Diese ist zwar anfangs gewöhnungsbedürftig und nicht jede Farbgebung trifft den Geschmack, aber man gewöhnt sich recht schnell dran.

Der Soundtrack plätschert leicht im Hintergrund und untermalt die Szenerie auf angenehme Art und Weise.

Es ist mit ca. drei bis maximal vier Stunden ein sehr kurzes Game und die Story ist eher flach, ebenso wie das Gameplay, welches recht monoton ist und aus den immer gleichen Handlungen besteht.

Auch wenn Support für kleine Entwicklerstudios eine gute Sache ist, ist ein stattlicher Preis von über 16 Euro meiner Meinung nach einfach unangemessen und daher kann ich leider keine Kaufempfehlung aussprechen.

Aber ich bereue nicht es gespielt zu haben und bin dankbar, dass es mir kostenlos zur Verfügung gestellt wurde.

Es trifft aber leider nicht meinen Geschmack.


Lg SyS
 
sys.da.prototyp

2.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 avril 2021
Classic pancakes
Ingredients for approx. 10 pieces with a diameter of 24cm:
150g of wheat flour
pinch of salt
2 eggs
250ml of milk
100ml of sparkling mineral water (or milk)
1 tablespoon of vanilla sugar (if you want the pancakes to be sweet)
frying oil or clarified butter

A method of preparing:
Pour flour, a pinch of salt and vanilla sugar into a bowl. Pour the milk with water and stir vigorously with a whisk so that no lumps are formed. Add the eggs and mix again. (You can also mix the dough with a mixer). If there are lumps, you can pour the dough through a strainer. It is best to leave the dough for at least 30 minutes to rest (but not necessary).

Preheat a frying pan (preferably a Teflon one). Add a little oil. (I recommend spreading the oil with a silicone brush). Stir the dough again. Pour a little dough with a ladle into the center of the pan and, agitating it, spread it over the entire surface. Fry until the bottom is browned, and the top is curdled, i.e. no longer liquid. Turn over with a spatula and fry for a moment until golden.

by the time i had decided that i really didnt like this game it was already too late for me to request a refund because i had already played the game for three hours

bad things about this game
THE COLOR SCHEME
i dont know why the developers chose this eye pain of a color scheme like didnt they themselves get some sort of eye pain when they worked on this game. because choosing to limit each level to one major hue of purple or pink is not it
i seriously got some sort of weird eye pain after this like wtf i am assuming these guys went to school to learn game dev and must have learnt the importance of colors in video games. so why did they choose to do this. why did they choose to utilize a color scheme that literally can cause pain to the eyes after playing the game for too long/
also the gameplay of this game relies heavily on survelliance.

did the thought of having to survey just one horrid color scheme for long periods of time is your cup of tea than this game is for you otherwise its a huge no.
the could have just made this game a normal color so the fact that they chose to make the game weird looking in order to have it be ''artsy'' or whatever just bothers me

Roseburrow
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 janvier
A charming little nature game that reminds me of Firewatch, but instead of someone's past haunting them, you get squirrels. You get a camera, then two, then three, and track squirrels during the night in order to fight back against a corporation that intends to demolish fictional Melmoth forest's wildlife all to build a dam. The squirrels are more intelligent than you think they are, and the whole story serves as a well-wrapped metaphor about the interaction between humanity and the natural world. If I had a penny each time I wanted to pet one of the squirrels, I'd be able to get a DSLR of my own. That said, the ending struck a warm note in my heart (especially the huge mound of nuts in the ship and how the squirrels guided you )

Your only human companions are Nina and Simon, the two people who help you along the way (one of them going missing later on but that's a mystery we may never uncover). You get tidbits of Nina's life when she was in your shoes years ago, and it's honestly really touching to see how empathetic she is of the natural world.

This is the second time I've played a game like this one (Firewatch being the first) and I highly recommend it. I promise you it's not creepy even though the music makes it seem that way some times. 8.5/10
 
sunflowa
70 produits enregistrés
0

Recommandé
12.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 décembre 2023
A unique puzzle game that is quite fun to explore and leaves you full of tension through the game.

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 décembre 2023
This game is NUTS !!

Genuinely so much fun, I caught myself with my face creeping up close to the monitor multiple times. The gameplay is way more fun than it looks and the story is a perfect length. The colour and music transitions worked so so so well. If you haven’t played it yet— PLEASE DO !!

The Steam page gave me the impression that it was going to be nonimmersive and retina-burning but I am very happy to say that I was disproved within only a few minutes of playing. Requires very little thinking for high payoffs; I think it would be perfect for anyone who likes puzzles but often finds them too difficult. Not to mention the POLISH — it is SO rare that I but I never had a single problem nor noticed any glitches/bugs at ALL. So much dedication.

My ONLY complaint would be the highish price vs. short playtime — but just wait to buy it during a sale ! I can understand the devs wanting to charge higher considering how much work went into it and the uniqueness, but on policy a short game is never worth more than £8/$10.
 
Pseudo

Recommandé
4.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 décembre 2023
In "Nuts" übernimmt der Spieler die Rolle eines Forschers, der in einem Wald arbeitet und die Bewegungen von Eichhörnchen studiert. Das Spiel zeichnet sich durch eine einzigartige Ästhetik, fesselnde Atmosphäre und ein ungewöhnliches Gameplay aus. Die Spieler verwenden Ausrüstung wie Kameras und GPS, um das Verhalten der Eichhörnchen zu beobachten und deren Bewegungen zu verfolgen.

Es handelt sich um ein unkonventionelles Spiel mit einer Mischung aus Erkundung, Rätseln und einer faszinierenden Handlung. Spieler müssen sorgfältig planen und Strategien entwickeln, um die Geheimnisse des Waldes zu entschlüsseln.

Besonder hat mir der Kontrast zwischen der simple gehaltenen Grafik und den Features der Kameras gefallen.
 
CeeJay

Évaluation publiée le 25 novembre 2023
セールで￥615にて購入。
カメラを設置して森に現れるリスの動きを追跡し、巣や餌の貯蔵庫を見つけるという流れが楽しいです。
ヤマをはって大きく動かして何も映らなかったり、見つけたと思ったら違うリスだと怒られたり。
リスの挙動も実にリアルで追跡のしがいがあります。
パステルカラーのマップやモデルは最初はややめんくらいますがすぐなれます。もし現実の色のままだったらリスを見つけるのに数倍苦労することになりそうですし…。

ストーリー部分はだいぶアッサリしており、追跡の動機やバリエーションを与えるための添え物の感があります。
リスが可愛いからヨシ！
 
moiky(mono)

Recommandé
3.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 novembre 2023
I always wanted to play a game involving placing cameras down and recording. This game is a perfect way to do the concept without it being a side feature in a monster hunter game. I love the art-style, how it makes it easier to spot what you're looking for in the footage. The use of older technology like vcrs and ctr tvs made it feel advanced in a cassette-futurism kind of way.

I wish there were more games like this!

Évaluation publiée le 19 novembre 2023
I think this is a very interesting concept of a game. The premise of this is that you set up cameras, and basically follow a squirrels movement. If you have the patience to go through this, it can be a fun time. I found it tedious during specific portions just because I couldn't figure out where the squirrel went and kept having to reset my cameras. Its nice that it was voice acted as it adds another element to the game itself. I would recommend on sale if you have patience and enjoy a chill experience of monitoring squirrels.

りすのおしりを追っかけてお写真を撮らせていただくゲーム

定点カメラを仕掛け、リスの導線を探る。カメラを仕掛けては確認し、仕掛け直しては確認し、の繰り返し。
自由に写真も撮れるため、カメラの位置を工夫してドアップ写真だったりふわふわの写真を撮ることができる。

専門家を介して制作を行っているためか、リスの動きがかなり本格的。かつ話の中でリスの生態についても言及される。

あまりにかわいい。りす、らぶ
 
hokori

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 octobre 2023
Please don't miss this game! Please give it a try!! You will never regret it!!!

This is a game about ecological protection, and the overall atmosphere is created very well! Although there is only one player from beginning to end, players feel no sense of loneliness at all. Everything around you makes you feel very relaxed, and you will feel that everything in nature is accompanying you. The sense of immersion in the entire game is very strong!

The color matching of different chapters and time periods is perfect, and the combination with music can effectively stimulate players' emotions, giving them a great sense of immersion!

The process of the entire game is gradual, and the tutorial part can be said to be perfectly integrated into the game process, without making players feel restless at all. The plot arrangement is also very excellent!
The interaction between players and the game is very delicate. Although this is just a game, it seems that players are really manipulating the tools in the game in real life.

This game is a role model in the gaming industry, a game that allows players to gain and has positive social value! This game can really raise people's awareness of ecological protection!! A truly good game always allows players to gain and grow!!! A rare and great game!!!!
-------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------
请不要错过这个游戏！请试一试吧！！你绝对不会后悔的！！！

这是一部关于生态保护的游戏，整体的氛围感营造的非常棒！虽然从头到尾都只有玩家一人，但是玩家却丝毫感觉不到孤独感，周围的一切都让你觉得十分的放松，你会感觉到大自然里的一切都在陪伴着你。整部游戏的代入感非常的强烈！
不同章节不同时间段的色彩搭配十分完美，配合音乐能够非常好的调动玩家的情绪，让玩家非常有代入感！
整部游戏的流程循序渐进，教程部分可以说是完美的融入了游戏流程，丝毫不会让玩家感到烦躁。剧情安排也非常的出色！
玩家与游戏的互动非常的细腻，虽然这只是一部游戏，但是玩家好像真的在现实中去操作游戏里的那些工具。

这部游戏就是游戏界的楷模，一部能够让玩家有所收获且具有正面社会价值的游戏！这部游戏真的能够很好的唤起人们的生态保护意识！！真正得好游戏总是让玩家有所收获得到成长！！！难得一见的好游戏！！！！

202211下，t a o宝，支付宝红包，杉果，本平台，本平台充值折扣掉卡，indie gala，fanatical，humble，daily indie game，loot boy，它处自定义包入的本体约3元。爱人如己，目前就这，看以后追评。有中文的游戏请耐心自研体验乐趣，攻略指南尽量不用。不建议使用外挂，插件，作弊之类的，游戏都要这样搞，那现实里那更是如此了。兄弟萌，强烈建议不要第三方平台的小店买y u额，通过饰品等挂steam市场转的，高概率red信乃至封号，且行且珍惜。

Caerigna
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 juin 2023
When I saw 'NUTS' I immediately got excited, it reminded me a bit of 'Firewatch' at least when watching the trailer and even when you play the first few chapters. While they both do have big things happening in the background of the story, this game is not nearly as mysterious as 'Firewatch,' it's not a bad thing, but the tone of the game sometimes makes it feel like you'll be facing similar situations.

You are playing as a ranger being sent out to different parts of the woods watching and surveying squirrels, where they go, where they come from, hidden nut stashes, their homes, etc etc. You do not want this mega corporation taking over, not when you can prove that their end goal is going to hurt the wildlife. A message we as humankind should be taking into account and listening to, but of course we do not.

Gameplay well, it's a walking simulator most of the time it's you going into these targeted zones and placing cameras, you'll sit in your little camper with the tvs on just surveying where certain squirrels are going. I actually liked this part a lot, it gives you a different mechanic to use other than just walking, and you aren't rushed with it either, you can take as long as you need to finish up whatever you're surveying. It can be quite tedious especially towards the end, it might take you quite a bit of time just figuring things out especially in the junkyard.

I also really liked the graphical style they went with, the color palette is a really good and a unique thing to see. I like how every chapter will change the palette as well. They do a great job of also highlighting interactive objects with abstracting colors, not too abstract to where it doesn't feel in the correct atmosphere, but enough to show you "hey you can use this."

Overall I would recommend NUTS, however I would advise finding it at a lower price because for what it does it does really well, but there isn't a whole lot of content here to justify $20, I got this in a mystery bundle so I got it at a really good deal, but still just wait for a sale. Works great on Linux as well.
 
TheBlueFiend
848 produits enregistrés
0

NUTS würde ich als ein nettes kleines Erkundungsspiel bei dem man etwas detektivisch Kameras aufstellen muss. Dann man die netten kleinen Hörnchen finden muss bzw deren weg verfolgen muss.
Während man diese Aufgaben erfüllt bekommt man eine nette kleine Story erzählt.

Wenn man bereit ist diesen anderen Style zu akzeptieren der kann mit diesem Spiel viel Spaß haben.
 
Tomba
881 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 mai 2023
Nuts is an interesting little one, certainly stylistic, with an almost Five Nights At Freddy’s meets nature surveillance sort of vibe. At least, at first. Not to reveal too much, but it is more of a Fire Watch type of title with less walking and more watching.

I liked it despite some of the camera placement tedium; the ending especially delighted me. I can see some arguing that it is a little pricey for what it offers, but Nuts has a charm to it once everything is said and done.

If you, too, want to follow squirrels in the forest, Nuts is the game for you!

Évaluation publiée le 27 avril 2023
I just finished this with a casual 5.5 hours of game play. Overall I really enjoyed this game. I was a bit confused at times as to what was going on with the story. I also don't understand the ending, but I had a great time getting there. It was a bit puzzly at times but didn't seem too difficult. I would recommend this for anyone looking for a cute, chill few hours of squirrel watching.

Recommandé
4.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 avril 2023
NUTS is really visually interesting and has nice voice acting, and the mechanics of using the cameras makes for an interesting challenge. A sort of chill, leisurely investigation unrolls. That said, the plot points that the first half of the game tries to set up sort of... doesn't go anywhere, in a vaguely frustrating way. I bought this game on sale and it was definitely worth doing at that rate, but I'm not sure the full price would be worth it.
 
rhiannon.marshall
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 avril 2023
NUTS is a unique game with lovely mechanics, and an amazing art style.

There are many photography games out there, sure. But I don't know about any others that allow you to place down the cameras and move them to your hearts content! And you can't forget the little camera in your pocket! Well, I did.
The journal was also a great feature, in my opinion. It has your To-Do list and a way to store photos if you need to compare them to the cameras.
You don't take fall damage, amazing! The creators didn't need the player to take damage to get the right feeling. The game feels ominous in a calming way. When I would walk around the woods or the swamp I wouldn't feel the need to turn around spontaneously or peek around corners, but I would often feel
like something was watching me. Squirrels? Birds? People? But I would almost always forget that feeling, as it would be replaced by the joy of running around, placing cameras, then checking them.


The colours are one of the most notable things throughout the game. I didn't know what to expect when I was downloading the game, but I was pleasantly surprised! The contrast of the squirrels to the backround is amazing. And they somehow hid the
stashes while having them be as noticeable as black on white. The way the colours changed from when you wake up to move the cameras and when you sleep to watch the squirrles is amazing! It is so noticeable but when the colours do change my mind doesn't even achknowledge it.
I personally think there should be more games with this style. It could be the new black and white!

As I was saying earlier, I really enjoy the night and day cycle. I'm pretty sure there is no limit to how many nights you can stay in one place. Not that I know of. But the thing I truly love is the way you just click a button and (NIGHT 8)
Then you go to bed or walk out the door and it abrubtly brings up a dark or light screen with (DAY 5) You get what I mean, right?


The whole world feels alive. When you're on the phone talking to Nina, when you watch the squirrels in your caravan, even as you ponder "what could be happening here at Melmoth Forest?" as you walk around, placing cameras. Even the slighest touch that you think nobody would notice, has an effect. Because we do notice, even if we don't even realise it.
The voice acting is amazing, so thank you Almut Schwacke. You can really hear the exitement or the concern in Nina's voice. The rustle of papers over the phone as you recieve a piece of paper a couple second after. The whole world, especially over the phone, feels alive.

Even though you are in an area fenced off from the world with chain link fence, it feels that Melmoth Forest is endless. As I jumped onto rocks and crouch
under bushes, I felt like I could get lost in this endless abyss. But then I look back down to my GPS, and realise "nope. I know where to go, I got work to do."
Another thing that feeds the endlessness of the forest is that the player never sees a human throughout the game. Not once. Squirrels and that's it. No birds, no rabbits. Just squirrels sitting in a tree as the leaves sway in the breeze.

SPOILERS AHEAD :
So near the end you slip on some rocks and fall. Then you come across this other caravan, and you contact Nina. She says that is her old caravan. You then try to follow the squirrel Bella to get your journal back. I had seen the squirrels cross
to the island and I didn't even think once about crossing myself, didn't think I would make it. On the stick, two squirrels merged to one. So I thought "Oh! One must have stayed on the tree and my journal is there!" No. I moved the cameras closer and THAT'S when I realised the squirrels merged. So, I watched a video and saw that
the player crossed the stick. Okay. So I crossed the stick and the rest is history. That was just a little confusing for me. Now I realise that it was kind of obvious that I would also cross to join the squirrels, but I thought that would be immediate death. But nope.


How the story ended was very interesting. No one expected it. I think the story is like a poem. The creator(s) had a specific meaning to it, but many different people interperated it in different ways. Personally, I don't know what to think.
I have a feeling that it's meant to say something about human corruption and nature either being a victim to it, or being smarter than us. We should help nature, or follow it. One of those two in my opinion.


I truly loved this game, yet it was so short. I think the world needs more of this. More games with this art style, more games that have a similiar meaning to it. More games that are so unique, that it's impossible to recreate. just like this one.
I'm not saying there should be a sequal, or even something part of the same universe, (the story of Nina would be cool) but that more games like this should be created.
A lot of people love this game, including myself. So I have a couple recomendations for you!

Alba: A Wildlife Adventure. More kid friendly but similar story and length.
Copoka. Haven't played it much, but it kind of gives off a vibe resembling NUTS.
Shelter 1, 2, and 3. Kind of related to this game. I still think you should check them out.
The Stillness of the Wind. It just gives me more mature vibes, as does NUTS.

 
DeliWolf11
1
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 avril 2023
Write a review for NUTS huh?
I like them roasted and salted, but not too much.

Jokes aside, nice and chill game, can easily be finished in a sitting or two.
The artstyle while interesting, can be hard on the eyes.
Story was fine, just that the ending felt somewhat lacking, questions left unanswered sort of deal.
For gameplay - what do you expect from walking simulator? But still, clever mechanic with the cameras, but also, made me explore a lot of the environment, if not for finding places without using cameras, then just to find where can you where your not supposed to, try to get past the boundaries to see some things up close.

Some may say that it's not worth the money, but that is entirely on you to figure out, and if not, just get it on sale.
Iv'e spent more on the new meh marvel movies, and I regret this less.

まっすぐプレイして多少繰り返しつつ2.8時間でクリア
値段の割にボリューム少な目
(調べてないけど)多分収集要素あり(半分取り逃した)
攻略作業がつまらなくなる前にエンディングを迎える潔さは良い
ウォーキングシミュレータを良くプレイする人なら逆にあるあるに感じてしまうかもしれない終盤の展開(なにもないよりかはマシ)
2000円帯には多くの名作傑作のADV,ウォーキングシミュレータがひしめき合っているだけに、
このゲームじゃなくては!!と他人に勧められるポイントはゲーム性とリスの可愛さ程度しかない
ビジュアルでプレイしてみたい!!と感じた方にはオススメできるが
そうでない方には単なる確認作業になるかもしれない

いずれにしろセールのタイミングでの購入が良いと思います

Recommandé
4.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 février 2023
Cutesy little game where you take photos of squirrels and vibe with the squirrels.

I've seen reviews criticising the colours and I personally can't speak on that because I'm colourblind, but I feel like if you looked at the trailer you knew what you were getting into and should've thought about that before buying. It's around 3 to 4 hours of gameplay and a fun little thing to do if you have some spare dosh lying around!

I really enjoyed it and I liked exploring the forest on my own.

My only issue was the first achievement didn't pop but that was because I skipped the cutscene at the end of chapter 1 instead of just letting it play so that was my bad.
It has an interesting story but I will admit, the ending was a bit weird

Recommandé
4.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 février 2023
一个相当精美小巧都游戏。
- 清新脱俗的美术风格（个人很喜欢
- 拍照玩法中后期略显无聊（不是松鼠只会在地上走吗？我相机永远都是往地上看，让松鼠往树上蹦几次都好啊）
- 最终剧情的开放式处理我觉得挺好，环境保护啊和大公司斗争啊这一套尝过很多遍了，这样一个以松鼠这种单一视角展开的小故事没有必要展开得非常深刻和尖锐：如果最终结尾给出了答案，不管是打败了大公司还是没打败，都会给我一种草草了事的庸俗感。主角和松鼠们最终的相遇和存活，反而让我觉得有点浪漫，就这样挺好。

Spilled Eggnog
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 janvier 2023
Basically you alone in the forest stalking squirrels and sometimes talking to a woman on the phone


• But talking realisticly its a pretty weird game, and thats why i love it. Its unique. It has a weird visual style which reminds me of Manifold Garden.

• Sometimes you can tired of color scheme tho, especially if you playing in a dark room. Due to a lot of use of white colors during the daytime in a game, so haters of white themes on social media will probably hate this style.

• Talking about the story: Even tho the game is pretty monotonous, the story drives you to move further into the game. Its basically a detective game which makes you want to find out how the story will end.

• Graphics and Optimization: Honestly the graphics dont really change in low or ultra setting, but there is some parts of the game which makes my 1050Ti cry, espesially the swamp location (fps drops to 20fps)

• HowLongToBeat: personally havent completed the game yet, but will do. I heard it can be completed in less than 4 hours.

• Pace: Most of the game is a very slow gameplay, but some parts require you to chase squirrels.

My overall feedback that is definitely a must buy for fans of walking simulators and detective games. I give it 8/10

Évaluation publiée le 27 décembre 2022
It's a funky game with a unique mechanism, and a cool art-style and good voice acting. A short game you can finish in 2 hours, but well worth the money for a unique experience. While some people look down on games with short lengths, compared to the price of a movie ticket, you'll get more bang for your buck here than at the local theater.
 
John J Pershing
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
15.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 décembre 2022
This game will give you a fun afternoon. (don't like at the time i played, i left it open for a whole day)

The art is cute and the puzzles use an interesting mechanic.

The only way this game could have been better is if the squirrels were the Capitalists, truly a missed opportunity here.
